analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so // de @186a * //

analyzed: de la yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa gnyis kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa las rnam par nyams par gyur na /

original: pha rol dang bdag la brten nas /üîΩkhrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dag skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩltung ba las phyir gso bar byed pa dang / rnam par nyams par ma gyur pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'di pha rol dang bdag nyid las kyang khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur pas tshul khrims kun du srung bar 'gyur ro //

original: bsrungs bas na 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsrungs bas na 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul khrims te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul khrims te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dpag tu med pa yongs su bsdus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it includes the immeasurable trainings of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: bla na med @186b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu len par byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang phan yon che bar rig par bya'o //

original: tshul khrims thams cad ces bya ba la /üîΩthams cad kyi tshul khrims thams cad de /
analyzed: tshul khrims thams cad ces bya ba la / thams cad kyi tshul khrims thams cad de /

analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dag la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All morality is threefold in all its forms, because it is based on the side of the householders and the side of those gone forth into the homeless life.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //

translated: Since there are five types of these, divided into bhik·π£u, bhik·π£u·πáƒ´, ≈õik·π£amƒÅ·πáƒÅ, ≈õrƒÅma·πáera, and ≈õrƒÅma·πáerikƒÅ,

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs rnam pa lnga'o //

original: khyim pa'i phyogs ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis ni khyim pa'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis ni khyim pa'i phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: there are two types of the side of the householder.

original: nyin zhag gcig pa'i yang dag par blangs pa ni dka' ba spyod pa dang 'dod pa las dben pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'di la 'os pa ma yin pas ma bstan to //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig pa'i yang dag par blangs pa ni dka' ba spyod pa dang 'dod pa las dben pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir 'di la 'os pa ma yin pas ma bstan to //
translated: The correct assumption for one day is not taught here, because it is not suitable, since it is not a practice of austerities and is not a separation from desire, and because it is not connected for a long time.

original: 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be taught like this:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: The pratimoksha vow is a branch of the bodhisattva vow.

original: phyogs gcig nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as just a part of it.

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gzhan dang ldan pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur pa la bslab pa'i tshig 'di yang sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gzhan dang ldan pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur pa la bslab pa'i tshig 'di yang sbyin par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this one who possesses another pratimoksha vow is a vessel for taking the bodhisattva vow. The meaning is that the words of training should be given to him.

original: 'di la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i cho ga gzhan pa nyid na mi yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i cho ga gzhan pa nyid na mi yin zhing /
translated: Here, if the rite of turning away from killing and so on is different, it is not a person.

original: de rnams las kyang ldog pa ma yin pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las kyang ldog pa ma yin pa la ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la yang dag par len pa'i snod du gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And those who are not even the opposite of those are not vessels for taking up the bodhisattva vow.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pas ni rnam par 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid la dgongs nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes dang por bstan to //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pas ni rnam par 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid la dgongs nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes dang por bstan to //
translated: With a pure intention, it is destroyed. With this very thought, it is taught that one should first be endowed with morality.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa 'di ni tshul khrims thams cad ces bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa 'di ni tshul khrims thams cad ces bstan to //
translated: Thus, this bodhisattva vow is taught as all morality.

original: de lta bu'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di la gnas na tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par @187a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims 'di la gnas na tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par @187a * //
translated: If one abides in this morality of such a vow, the aggregate of morality is fulfilled.

original: 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe 'di ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyang bor nas rab tu byung ba de la 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la rtsva dang mi gtsang ba lta bur mi blta bar 'gyur ba ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas yin gyi gzhan ni de
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe 'di ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyang bor nas rab tu byung ba de la 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la rtsva dang mi gtsang ba lta bur mi blta bar 'gyur ba ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas yin gyi gzhan ni de
translated: When he renounces even the kingdom of a universal monarch and goes forth, he does not regard the kingdom of a universal monarch as a straw or something unclean.

original: lta ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ma yin te /
translated: This is due to the purity of his intention, not because of any other reason.

original: dman pa dag ni 'dod pa dang 'tsho ba'i don du rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa dag ni 'dod pa dang 'tsho ba'i don du rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Inferior persons go forth for the sake of sensual pleasure and livelihood.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus yang sdom pa la dbang du gyur bar yongs su 'thob pa'i 'dod pa rnams la yang mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus yang sdom pa la dbang du gyur bar yongs su 'thob pa'i 'dod pa rnams la yang mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: In the future, he will not become one who delights in the objects of desire, having attained mastery over the vows.

original: de'i don du smon pas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i don du smon pas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par mi byed de /
translated: He does not practice pure conduct with the hope of attaining those objects.

original: 'dod pa rnams la 'jigs pa chen po sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa'i nags tshal du 'jug pa lta bur yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis kun du mthong nas mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la 'jigs pa chen po sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa'i nags tshal du 'jug pa lta bur yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis kun du mthong nas mi 'jug go //
translated: With right wisdom, he sees that the objects of desire are like entering a forest filled with various great dangers and does not enter them.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi 'dod pa chen po dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti rgya chen po dag la yang skyugs pa'i zas bzhin du ro myong bar mi byed na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi 'dod pa chen po dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti rgya chen po dag la yang skyugs pa'i zas bzhin du ro myong bar mi byed na /
translated: Now, if he does not relish the great gain and honor of all those who have great desires in the present time, as if it were vomit,

original: dman pa rnams kyis dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dman pa rnams kyis dman pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: how much less would he relish the inferior of those who are inferior?

original: gcig pu rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: gcig pu rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba yin la /
translated: He delights in being alone and secluded.

original: tshogs kyi nang du yang rung sems dben pas gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du yang rung sems dben pas gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Even in the midst of the assembly, he remains in a secluded state of mind.

original: tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi /
translated: He does not consider mere morality to be sufficient.

original: 'on kyang tshul khrims la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa gang yin pa de dag mngon par bsgrub pa dang / dbang du gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshul khrims la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa gang yin pa de dag mngon par bsgrub pa dang / dbang du gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
translated: Rather, he strives to accomplish and master the immeasurable meditative absorptions of the bodhisattvas that are based on morality.

original: 'du 'dzi'i nang du 'dug kyang gtam ngan pa dang / tshig ngan pa cung zad kyang dang du len par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i nang du 'dug kyang gtam ngan pa dang / tshig ngan pa cung zad kyang dang du len par mi byed la /
translated: Even when he is in the midst of a crowd, he does not tolerate even the slightest negative action or negative word.

original: dben pa na 'dug kyang rtog pa ngan pa cung zad kyang mi sems so //
analyzed: dben pa na 'dug kyang rtog pa ngan pa cung zad kyang mi sems so //
translated: Even when alone, he does not think about any bad thoughts.

original: brjed ngas pas kun du spyod par gyur na yang dus dus su shin tu 'gyod pa dang / nyes pa mthong ba yang skyed par byed de /
analyzed: brjed ngas pas kun du spyod par gyur na yang dus dus su shin tu 'gyod pa dang / nyes pa mthong ba yang skyed par byed de /
translated: Even when he is carried away by forgetfulness, he generates remorse from time to time and he sees the fault.

original: gang gi tshe gtam ngan pa dang / rtog pa ngan pa yang skyes ma thag tu myur ba nyid du dran pa skyed par byed cing mi bya ba'i sems kyang thob par 'gyur te /

translated: Whenever bad speech or bad thoughts arise, he immediately generates mindfulness and he does not allow himself to do it.

original: des na spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, he abandons it.

translated: Through practice in abandoning, he gradually comes to delight in not doing it as much as he formerly delighted in doing it, and he abides in a state that is not in accord with doing it.

analyzed: sa chen @187b por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rgya che ba rnams dang / dpag tu med pa rnams dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams dang / yun ring ba rnams dang / shin tu bya dka' ba rnams de thos nas skrag pa'am zhum par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: When they hear about the extensive, immeasurable, inconceivable, long-lasting, and extremely difficult practices of the bodhisattvas who have entered the great stages, they are not frightened or discouraged.

original: gzhan du na 'di ltar de dag kyang mir gyur pa las rim gyis bslabs nas dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di ltar de dag kyang mir gyur pa las rim gyis bslabs nas dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: Rather, they think, ‚ÄúThey too, as human beings, gradually trained and came to possess immeasurable and inconceivable physical and verbal vows.

original: bdag nyid kyang mir gyur pas rim gyis bslabs na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mir gyur pas rim gyis bslabs na /
translated: And I too, as a human being, if I gradually train,

translated: He is full of love and compassion for them.

analyzed: sdig pa can gyis tshig 'byin pa'am slar 'tshog pa lta ga la byed /
translated: Even if others strike him with their hands, clods of earth, sticks, or weapons, he does not become upset, much less would he utter evil words or strike them in return.

analyzed: de bzhin du gshe ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi reg pa las byung ba cung zad tsam gyis kyang gnod par mi byed do //

original: lhan cig rjes su @188a * //
analyzed: lhan cig rjes su @188a * //
translated: Vigil

original: spyod pa ni gang dus snga mar bya ba'i bdag yod par 'di nyid la gnas nas ci nas kyang 'di la ltung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni gang dus snga mar bya ba'i bdag yod par 'di nyid la gnas nas ci nas kyang 'di la ltung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The practice is to abide in this very life, with the thought that the self that is to be acted upon in the past exists, and to act so that it will not fall into this.

original: dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / sdig pa mi 'chab pa dang 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / skyo ba med pa'i ngang tshul can dang / rgod pa med pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms pa dang / sdig pa mi 'chab pa dang 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / skyo ba med pa'i ngang tshul can dang / rgod pa med pa dang / mi g-yeng ba dang /
translated: Not boasting of virtue, not concealing sin, having few desires, being content, being patient with suffering, having a nature that is not discouraged, not being agitated, not being distracted,

original: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang / kha gsag la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos thams cad rnam par spang ba ste /
analyzed: spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang / kha gsag la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos thams cad rnam par spang ba ste /
translated: having a very peaceful demeanor, and completely abandoning all the dharmas that are wrong for a living, such as flattery.

original: de ltar na yan lag bcu po de rnams dang ldan pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims legs par sdom pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag bcu po de rnams dang ldan pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims legs par sdom pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who abides in the morality of restraint with these ten limbs has the morality of well-restrained morality.

original: 'di lta ste snga ma 'das pa'i 'dod pa rnams la mi lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' bar mi byed pa dang / da ltar gyi rnams la mi chags pa dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste snga ma 'das pa'i 'dod pa rnams la mi lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' bar mi byed pa dang / da ltar gyi rnams la mi chags pa dang / rab tu dben pa la mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: It is as follows: not looking back at past desires, not being eager for future desires, not being attached to present desires, and delighting in solitude.

original: ngag dang rnam par rtog pa yongs su dag par byed pa dang / bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / des pa dang bzod pa dang / bag yod pa dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngag dang rnam par rtog pa yongs su dag par byed pa dang / bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / des pa dang bzod pa dang / bag yod pa dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of speech and thought, not disparaging oneself, and being gentle, patient, careful, and pure in one‚Äôs way of life.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu yang gang cung zad lus dang / ngag dang yid dag gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba gang ci yang rung ba bsags pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu yang gang cung zad lus dang / ngag dang yid dag gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba gang ci yang rung ba bsags pa ste /
translated: The morality of gathering virtuous factors is whatever wholesome one accumulates by means of body, speech, and mind, for the sake of Awakening, after having taken up the vows of restraint.

original: de yang khyad par du thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa rnams la gcig tu dga' bas mngon par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang khyad par du thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa rnams la gcig tu dga' bas mngon par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, he is devoted to listening, reflection, and the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: de bzhin du dus dus su bla ma rnams la gsod por smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon par ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang / zhe sa dang bcas pas kun du spyod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus dus su bla ma rnams la gsod por smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon par ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba dang / zhe sa dang bcas pas kun du spyod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
translated: Similarly, from time to time he speaks politely to his gurus, bows to them, rises up to greet them, respectfully joins his palms in homage, and serves them.

original: na ba rnams la brtse bas rim gro byed pa dang / legs par smra ba la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la ji lta ba nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la dga' ba'i sems kyis tshig gis rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: na ba rnams la brtse bas rim gro byed pa dang / legs par smra ba la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la ji lta ba nyid kyi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la dga' ba'i sems kyis tshig gis rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: He compassionately cares for the sick and praises those who have good qualities as if he were describing reality itself. With a mind of joy, he verbally congratulates all beings on their merits.

original: gzhan rnams kyis nyes pa byas pa thams cad la so sor @188b brtags te bzod pa byed pa dang / dge ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / dus dus su yang dag pa'i smon lam sna tshogs gdab pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis nyes pa byas pa thams cad la so sor @188b brtags te bzod pa byed pa dang / dge ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / dus dus su yang dag pa'i smon lam sna tshogs gdab pa dang /
translated: They are to cultivate patience by examining each and every one of their faults; to dedicate all their virtues to the attainment of perfect enlightenment; to make various pure aspirations from time to time;

original: mchod pa'i rnam pa rgya chen po thams cad kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus brtsam pa'i phyir rtag tu bag med pa spong ba dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas bslab pa'i bzhi rnams kun du bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: mchod pa'i rnam pa rgya chen po thams cad kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa dang dge ba'i phyogs la brtson 'grus brtsam pa'i phyir rtag tu bag med pa spong ba dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas bslab pa'i bzhi rnams kun du bsrung ba dang /
translated: to make offerings to the Three Jewels with all kinds of extensive offerings; to constantly avoid carelessness in order to be diligent in virtue; and to protect their precepts by being mindful and vigilant.

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / nyes pa yongs su shes shing mthong nas kyang nyes pa rnams yongs su spong ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdam pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / nyes pa yongs su shes shing mthong nas kyang nyes pa rnams yongs su spong ba dang /
translated: It is to restrain the senses, to know the right amount of food, to be diligent in the first and last periods of the night instead of sleeping, to rely on holy beings, to rely on spiritual friends, to see and understand faults and then to abandon them,

original: nyes pa rnams chos bzhin du 'chags pa dang / de lta bu'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / srung ba dang / spel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams chos bzhin du 'chags pa dang / de lta bu'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / srung ba dang / spel bar byed pa ste /
translated: to confess faults in accordance with the Dharma, to practice, guard, and increase virtuous qualities that are in accord with that,üîΩand to not give rise to even the slightest desire for the enjoyments of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims 'di la rnam par gnas na /
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims 'di la rnam par gnas na /
translated: In this way, if one abides in the discipline of gathering virtuous dharmas,

original: dge ba'i chos kyi tshul shin tu bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi tshul shin tu bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: one will gather the way of virtuous dharmas.

original: gang 'di 'dod pa'i longs spyod la lta ba cung zad tsam skyes pa dang du len par mi byed na /
analyzed: gang 'di 'dod pa'i longs spyod la lta ba cung zad tsam skyes pa dang du len par mi byed na /
translated: If one does not accept even the slightest desire for the enjoyments of sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: mang po lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: mang po lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: what need is there to mention many?

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i mongs pa chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / khong khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byung ba dang du len par mi byed do //üîΩpha rol po dag nye bar gnas pa na khong khro ba dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / shar gnyer ba'i sems byung ba dang du len pa'i mi byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i mongs pa chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / khong khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byung ba dang du len par mi byed do // pha rol po dag nye bar gnas pa na khong khro ba dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / shar gnyer ba'i sems byung ba dang du len pa'i mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate the arising of the afflictions and secondary afflictions that are the causes of immorality, such as desire, hatred, etc.,üîΩavarice, jealousy, anger, resentment, etc.

original: le lo dang snyoms las skyes pa yang dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: le lo dang snyoms las skyes pa yang dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate the arising of laziness and indolence.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i ro myang ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa byung ba yang dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i ro myang ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa byung ba yang dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: He does not tolerate the arising of the relishing of meditative concentration and the afflictions of meditative concentration.

original: gnas lnga la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gnas lnga la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows perfectly as it really is the five topics.

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i 'bras bu la phyin ci log pa dang / dge ba'i 'bras bu la phyin ci ma log pa dang / dge ba bsdu ba la bar du gcod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /üîΩde la @189a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba'i 'bras bu la phyin ci log pa dang / dge ba'i 'bras bu la phyin ci ma log pa dang / dge ba bsdu ba la bar du gcod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / de la @189a * //
translated: He knows well the benefits of the results of virtue, the cause of virtue, the error with regard to the results of virtue, the non-error with regard to the results of virtue, and the obstacles to the accumulation of virtue.

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu la yon tan du mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir dge ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu la yon tan du mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba bsdu ba'i phyir dge ba'i rgyu yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who sees the virtues of the results of virtue seeks the cause of virtue in order to accumulate virtue.

original: phyin ci log dang / phyin ci log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / phyin ci log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows well error and non-error with regard to the results of virtue.

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu thob nas mi rtag pa la rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu thob nas mi rtag pa la rtag par lta bar mi 'gyur ba nas /
translated: Having obtained the results of virtue, he does not see the impermanent as permanent, and so on up to

original: bdag med pa la yang bdag tu lta bar mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la yang bdag tu lta bar mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
translated: he does not see the insubstantial as substantial.

original: bar chad du gyur pa yang rab tu shes nas yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: bar chad du gyur pa yang rab tu shes nas yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: He knows well the obstacles and avoids them.

original: de ltar go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la nan tan du byed pa rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid kyis myur ba nyid du rnam pa thams cad du dge ba sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la nan tan du byed pa rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid kyis myur ba nyid du rnam pa thams cad du dge ba sdud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by these ten kinds of activities, one quickly and completely gathers virtue by means of the six perfections such as generosity, in the proper order.

original: yang sems can gyi byed pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: yang sems can gyi byed pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings has eleven aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad gnas pa ni re re yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin te /üîΩ'di la sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nye bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa thams cad gnas pa ni re re yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa yin te / 'di la sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nye bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings has each of the eleven aspects.üîΩHere, the work for the benefit of sentient beings is the activity of helping those who are in distress,

original: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung zhing skyes par gyur pa rnams la nad g-yog la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung zhing skyes par gyur pa rnams la nad g-yog la sogs pa'i grogs byed pa yin te /
translated: such as the sick, by nursing the sick, etc.

original: de 'dir de la sems pas grogs byed pa'i ched du 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: de 'dir de la sems pas grogs byed pa'i ched du 'gro bar byed /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva goes to help them, thinking of them.

original: de'i ched du lam du 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba dang / longs spyod pa rnams kun du bsrung ba dang / bye ba rnams sdum pa dang / dga' ston dang / bsod nams byed pa dag gi grogs su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i ched du lam du 'gro zhing 'ong ba dang yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba dang / longs spyod pa rnams kun du bsrung ba dang / bye ba rnams sdum pa dang / dga' ston dang / bsod nams byed pa dag gi grogs su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: For that purpose, he or she accompanies them when they go out on the road, when they engage in right livelihood, when they guard their possessions, when they reconcile their factions, when they celebrate, and when they perform meritorious deeds.

original: nad kyis btab pa rnams kyi nad g-yog dang / long ba rnams ni khrid cing lam ston par byed pa dang / 'on pa rnams ni go bar bya ba'i phyir lag brda'i mtshan ma nye bar bstan pas don go bar byed /
analyzed: nad kyis btab pa rnams kyi nad g-yog dang / long ba rnams ni khrid cing lam ston par byed pa dang / 'on pa rnams ni go bar bya ba'i phyir lag brda'i mtshan ma nye bar bstan pas don go bar byed /
translated: He or she nurses those who are sick. He or she leads the blind and shows the way to those who have lost their path. He or she makes himself or herself understood to the deaf by means of gestures.

original: rkang lag med pa rnams ni mgo'am bzhon pas 'khyer bar byed //
analyzed: rkang lag med pa rnams ni mgo'am bzhon pas 'khyer bar byed //
translated: He or she carries on his or her head or on his or her back those who have no arms or legs.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed //
translated: He or she dispels the suffering of those who are overwhelmed by the afflictions of sensual desire, etc., by means of the thoughts of sensual desire, etc.

original: gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa rnams kyi ni sma phab pa dang pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sma phab cing pham par byas pa rnams kyi ni sma phab pa dang pham par byas pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed //
translated: He removes the suffering of those who are humiliated and defeated by others.

original: lam gyis ngal bar gyur pa rnams la gnas dang bza' ba sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / lus mnye bas kyang lam gyis ngal ba dang @189b dub pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
analyzed: lam gyis ngal bar gyur pa rnams la gnas dang bza' ba sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / lus mnye bas kyang lam gyis ngal ba dang @189b dub pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
translated: He removes the suffering of fatigue and exhaustion on the path for those who are tired on the path by giving them a place to stay, food, drink, and so on, and by massaging their bodies.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du grogs byed pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams la chos bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi thabs nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rigs pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du grogs byed pa'o // 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams la chos bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi thabs nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rigs pa ston par byed de /
translated: This is the way he helps in every situation.üîΩHe teaches the Dharma to those who are engaged in mundane and supramundane activities, and he teaches them the methods that are preceded by the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de 'di ltar gzhan rnams la rigs pa ston par byed pa ni nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar gzhan rnams la rigs pa ston par byed pa ni nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston par byed pa'am /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are engaged in misconduct in order to make them give up their misconduct.

original: thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed pa de bzhin du ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna spong bar byed pa dang / tshe 'di la yang yang dag pa dang / tshegs chung ngus longs spyod rnams bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / bstan pa 'di la sdang ba rnams dad pa thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed pa de bzhin du ser sna can rnams kyi ser sna spong bar byed pa dang / tshe 'di la yang yang dag pa dang / tshegs chung ngus longs spyod rnams bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / bstan pa 'di la sdang ba rnams dad pa thob par bya ba dang /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha teaches the Dharma or teaches through skillful means in order to eliminate the stinginess of the stingy, to acquire enjoyments in this life through correct means and with little difficulty, to cause those who are hostile to the teaching to acquire faith,

original: mthong ba thob par bya ba dang / lta ba rnam par dag pas ngan song las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba thams cad mthar thug pas sdug bsngal ba thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'am thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba thob par bya ba dang / lta ba rnam par dag pas ngan song las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba thams cad mthar thug pas sdug bsngal ba thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'am thabs mkhas pas kyang ston par byed do //
translated: to cause those who have acquired faith to acquire the vision of the noble truths, to cause those who have acquired the vision to transcend the miserable destinies through the purification of view, and to cause those who have acquired the bonds to transcend all suffering through the exhaustion of all the bonds.

original: 'di ni rigs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of all aspects of reasoning.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba rjes su 'dzin par byed cing rjes su mthun pa'i lan du phan 'dogs pas bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i sems can rnams la byas pa gzo ba rjes su 'dzin par byed cing rjes su mthun pa'i lan du phan 'dogs pas bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: He repays the help of those sentient beings who have helped him, and he helps them in return, by being helpful in a way that is appropriate to them.

original: de 'di ltar byas pa gzo ba la dga' ba dang ldan pas lan du phan 'dogs pa mthong nas gus par bya ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar byas pa gzo ba la dga' ba dang ldan pas lan du phan 'dogs pa mthong nas gus par bya ste /
translated: He is pleased with gratitude, and he is respectful when he sees someone who repays his help.

original: tshur spyon legs par byon to zhes brjod pas smra zhing kun du smra la yang dag par dga' bar byed /
analyzed: tshur spyon legs par byon to zhes brjod pas smra zhing kun du smra la yang dag par dga' bar byed /
translated: He speaks to them and greets them with words of welcome, such as ‚ÄúCome here! Welcome!‚Äù

original: gnas dang stan bstabs pas kyang bsdu bar byed de //
analyzed: gnas dang stan bstabs pas kyang bsdu bar byed de //
translated: He also attracts them by offering them a place to stay and a seat.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i lan de dang mnyam pa'am lhag pas nye bar gnas par byed do //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i lan de dang mnyam pa'am lhag pas nye bar gnas par byed do //
translated: He repays their gain and honor with an amount that is equal to or greater than their original gain and honor.

original: gzhan yang de'i bya ba rnams la ma bcol bar yang grogs byed du 'gro na bcol ba la lta ci smos //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i bya ba rnams la ma bcol bar yang grogs byed du 'gro na bcol ba la lta ci smos //
translated: He also helps them with their work without being asked, let alone when asked.

original: de bzhin du 'dir rnams pa gzhan yang bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir rnams pa gzhan yang bya ba yin no //
translated: In this way, he is helpful in other ways as well.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du byas pa gzo ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du byas pa gzo ba'o //
translated: This is the way he is grateful and helpful in every way.

original: sems can 'jigs pa rnams 'jigs pa'i gnas dag las srung bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can 'jigs pa rnams 'jigs pa'i gnas dag las srung bar byed do //
translated: He protects sentient beings from the fear of all the places of fear.

original: sems can rnams gcan gzan gyi gnod pa'i 'jigs pa las kyang bsrung zhing //
analyzed: sems can rnams gcan gzan gyi gnod pa'i 'jigs pa las kyang bsrung zhing //
translated: He protects sentient beings from the fear of harm from wild animals.üîΩHe protects from the fear of the waves and the fear of the sea monsters,

original: chu'i glong dang chu srin 'dzin khri'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa @190a * //
analyzed: chu'i glong dang chu srin 'dzin khri'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i 'jigs pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa @190a * //
translated: from the fear of kings, from the fear of robbers,

original: dang / phyi rol pa'i 'jigs pa dang / rje bo dang bdag po'i 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa dang / mi ma yin pa dang ro langs kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa las kyang yongs su srung bar byed do //
analyzed: dang / phyi rol pa'i 'jigs pa dang / rje bo dang bdag po'i 'jigs pa dang / 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa dang / mi ma yin pa dang ro langs kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa las kyang yongs su srung bar byed do //
translated: from the fear of non-Buddhists, from the fear of masters and owners, from the fear of lack of livelihood, from the fear of disrepute, from the fear of embarrassment in the midst of the assembly, from the fear of spirits and zombies, and so on.

original: de rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gnas kyi rnam pa thams cad las kun du srung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gnas kyi rnam pa thams cad las kun du srung ba'o //
translated: He protects them from all the forms of fear and danger.

original: yang gnyen bshes dang longs spyod kyis phongs pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed de /
analyzed: yang gnyen bshes dang longs spyod kyis phongs pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed de /
translated: He also dispels the sorrow of those who are destitute of friends and wealth.

original: de yang 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi gnas rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi gnas rnams kyi mya ngan sel bar byed pa ste /

translated: he does not conform to their minds out of compassion for them.

original: bdag nyid la lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gang gis pha rol dag la sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar mthong la kun du spyod pa de yang bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid la lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gang gis pha rol dag la sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye bar mthong la kun du spyod pa de yang bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: He sees that his own physical and verbal conduct causes others to experience pain and mental unhappiness, and that such conduct is not included in the precepts.

original: bla na med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang ma yin la /üîΩsdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang ma yin la / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du ste /
translated: It is not the accumulation of the highest merit and wisdom.

original: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir kun du spyod par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir kun du spyod par ni mi byed do //
translated: And he does not conform to the minds of others with that pain and mental unhappiness, in order to turn them away from unwholesome conduct, as before.

original: gal te kun du spyod pa 'di bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yin zhing sngom par gtogs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te kun du spyod pa 'di bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yin zhing sngom par gtogs pa yang yin la /
translated: If this conduct is included in the precepts and included in the vows,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba des kyang gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du ste /
translated: and if he does not cause others to engage in nonvirtue through that suffering and mental dissatisfaction,

original: gzhan dag la snying brtse ba nye bar bzung nas kun tu spyod par ni mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag la snying brtse ba nye bar bzung nas kun tu spyod par ni mi byed de /
translated: then he does not engage in conduct out of compassion for others.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang yid bde ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true of happiness and mental pleasure.

original: rgyas par ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail as appropriate.

original: 'di gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa na pha rol po khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhi bar ma gyur gyi bar du mngon sum du bsngags pa yang mi brjod la /
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa na pha rol po khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhi bar ma gyur gyi bar du mngon sum du bsngags pa yang mi brjod la /
translated: When he is in accord with the minds of others, he does not praise others in their presence until their anger is pacified.

original: shad kyis sbyangs pa yang mi byed na bsngags pa yang ma yin pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: shad kyis sbyangs pa yang mi byed na bsngags pa yang ma yin pa lta ci smos /
translated: If he does not praise them, what need is there to mention that he does not speak ill of them?

original: gzhan mi smra ba la yang smra zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed na /
analyzed: gzhan mi smra ba la yang smra zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed na /
translated: If he does not speak to others, he does not speak to them.

original: smra bar byed pa la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: smra bar byed pa la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much more so when it is to praise them!

original: gzhan dag la nam yang 'khrul par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag la nam yang 'khrul par mi byed kyi /
translated: He never deceives others.

original: gzhan du na de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir sma dbab par 'dod par zad de /
analyzed: gzhan du na de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir sma dbab par 'dod par zad de /
translated: He only wants to reproach them out of compassion.

original: dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bas de dag sma 'bebs par byed do //üîΩgzhan @192a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bas de dag sma 'bebs par byed do // gzhan @192a * //
translated: He reproaches them with his faculties calm.

original: dag la 'phya bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: dag la 'phya bar yang mi byed /
translated: He does not ridicule others.

original: bsting bar yang mi byed la bag 'khums par yang mi byed do //üîΩbde ba la reg par mi gnas pa'i phyir 'gyod pa skyed par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: bsting bar yang mi byed la bag 'khums par yang mi byed do // bde ba la reg par mi gnas pa'i phyir 'gyod pa skyed par yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not insult them. He does not humiliate them.üîΩHe does not reproach them, because he does not want to make them feel bad.

original: chad pas bcad cing sma phab zin pa la yang chad pa'i gnas kyis gleng bar mi byed do //
analyzed: chad pas bcad cing sma phab zin pa la yang chad pa'i gnas kyis gleng bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not remind them of something they did wrong.

original: dga' ba'i shas chung ba la yang bdag nyid mthong bar mi ston to //
analyzed: dga' ba'i shas chung ba la yang bdag nyid mthong bar mi ston to //
translated: He does not show himself to those who have little faith.

original: gzhan dag la mi bsten par yang mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag la mi bsten par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not avoid those who have faith.

original: ha cang bsten par yang mi byed /
analyzed: ha cang bsten par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not associate too much with them.

original: dus ma yin par bsten par yang mi byed /
analyzed: dus ma yin par bsten par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not associate with them at the wrong time.

original: de dag gi mdun du mdza' bo la smod pa yang mi byed /
analyzed: de dag gi mdun du mdza' bo la smod pa yang mi byed /
translated: In their presence, he does not disparage his friends.

original: mi mdza' ba'i bsngags pa yang mi brjod //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i bsngags pa yang mi brjod //
translated: He does not praise his enemies.

original: ma 'dris pa la yid rton par yang mi byed /
analyzed: ma 'dris pa la yid rton par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not trust those who are not his friends.

original: rgyun du slong bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: rgyun du slong bar yang mi byed /
translated: He does not constantly beg.

original: len pa la tshod shes par yang byed /
analyzed: len pa la tshod shes par yang byed /
translated: He knows the proper amount to take.

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa mgron du bos na yang spong bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa mgron du bos na yang spong bar yang mi byed do //
translated: If he is invited to eat or drink, he does not refuse.

original: yang na chos dang mthun par shad kyis sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na chos dang mthun par shad kyis sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Or, if he is invited to a Dharma discussion, he goes.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i yon tan gyi dbye ba nye bar bzung na gzhan dag tu gsal bar ston pas yang dag par dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par byed pa'o // yang dag pa'i yon tan gyi dbye ba nye bar bzung na gzhan dag tu gsal bar ston pas yang dag par dga' bar byed de /
translated: This is how he always acts in accordance with the minds of others.üîΩWhen he sees that others have real good qualities, he praises them in a way that is clear to everyone.

original: de 'di ltar yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis gzhan kun du dga' bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de 'di ltar yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis gzhan kun du dga' bar byed pa na /
translated: He does not praise others with insincere praise.

original: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gang dang gang ldan pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab la sogs pa yon tan gang dang gang ldan pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He or she delights them with conversation that is related to whatever spiritual qualities they possess, such as faith, morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is the way to delight them in every respect.

original: gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas la dgod pa'i phyir 'jam pa dang phan pa'i bsam pas sma dbab pa dang / chad pas bcad pa'am bskrad par bya ba dag gis tshar bcad pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas la dgod pa'i phyir 'jam pa dang phan pa'i bsam pas sma dbab pa dang / chad pas bcad pa'am bskrad par bya ba dag gis tshar bcad pa'i las byed do //
translated: In order to lift others out of opportunities nonvirtuous and establish them in opportunities virtuous, with a gentle and helpful attitude, he or she punishes those who need to be threatened, punished, or banished, by threatening, punishing, or banishing them.

original: de yang nyes pa chung ngu la ni sma dbab pa chung ngus sma 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: de yang nyes pa chung ngu la ni sma dbab pa chung ngus sma 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Moreover, for a minor offense, he or she threatens with a minor punishment.

original: nyes pa 'bring la ni 'bring gis so //
analyzed: nyes pa 'bring la ni 'bring gis so //
translated: For a middling offense, he or she threatens with a middling punishment.

original: nyes pa chen po la ni chen pos so //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po la ni chen pos so //
translated: For a major offense, he or she threatens with a major punishment.

original: chad pa'i las kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chad pa'i las kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood with regard to the application of the punishment.

original: bskrad pa'i las la nyes pa chung ngu dang 'bring dag la ni dus re zhig tu bskrad nas slar dgug pa'i tshul gyis skrod par byed do //üîΩnyes pa chen po la ni de dag la snying brtse bas /
analyzed: bskrad pa'i las la nyes pa chung ngu dang 'bring dag la ni dus re zhig tu bskrad nas slar dgug pa'i tshul gyis skrod par byed do // nyes pa chen po la ni de dag la snying brtse bas /
translated: In the case of minor and middling offenses, one banishes them for a while and then brings them back.üîΩIn the case of grave offenses, one banishes them for life, not bringing them back, out of compassion for them,

original: de dag la bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang po yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur par bya @192b ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang phan par 'dod pas rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang phyir mi dgug pa'i tshul gyis skrod par byed cing longs spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag la bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang po yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur par bya @192b ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la yang phan par 'dod pas rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang phyir mi dgug pa'i tshul gyis skrod par byed cing longs spyod par mi byed do //
translated: so that they will not accumulate much demerit, and out of a desire to help others, by teaching them.

original: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad du tshar gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad du tshar gcod pa'o //
translated: These are the ways of completely subduing.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis gzhan dag skrag bar byed 'dod pa na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis gzhan dag skrag bar byed 'dod pa na /
translated: If one wishes to frighten others by the power of one‚Äôs supernormal knowledge,

original: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams la nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams dang / grang ba'i dmyal ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song gi 'gro ba de dag bsten cing bsnyen la ston par byed cing mir gyur pa dag gis nyes par spyod pa byas shing bsags pa mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mi bzad cing mchog tu tshaüîΩba so sor nyams su myong ba 'di lta bu 'di la khyod ltos shig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: sems can nyes par spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams la nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams dang / grang ba'i dmyal ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song gi 'gro ba de dag bsten cing bsnyen la ston par byed cing mir gyur pa dag gis nyes par spyod pa byas shing bsags pa mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mi bzad cing mchog tu tsha ba so sor nyams su myong ba 'di lta bu 'di la khyod ltos shig ces bsgo nas /
translated: They say, ‚ÄòLook at this, which is the result of the negative actions that you have committed and accumulated, and which you will experience in the form of the most terrible and supreme burning pain.‚Äô

original: de dag gis kyang de lta bu mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de lta bu mthong ste /
translated: They see this and

original: skrag cing skyo bar gyur nas mi dge ba las bzlog cing /üîΩbstan pa la btsud nas 'dun par byed /
analyzed: skrag cing skyo bar gyur nas mi dge ba las bzlog cing / bstan pa la btsud nas 'dun par byed /
translated: become frightened and distressed, and they turn away from nonvirtue.

original: mgu bar byed /
analyzed: mgu bar byed /
translated: They are introduced to the teachings and are made to be interested in them.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: They are made to be pleased with them.üîΩThey are made to be delighted with them.

original: yang na rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Or else, by means of the various kinds of supernormal accomplishments,

original: 'gro ba du ma'i lus kyi dbang byed pa'i bar gyis 'dun par byas /
analyzed: 'gro ba du ma'i lus kyi dbang byed pa'i bar gyis 'dun par byas /
translated: up to the control of the bodies of many beings, he causes them to be inspired,

original: mgu bar byas /
analyzed: mgu bar byas /
translated: to be satisfied,üîΩto be delighted.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byas nas ma dad pa rnams ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la dgod par byed /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byas nas ma dad pa rnams ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la dgod par byed /
translated: Those who are without faith he establishes in perfect faith.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa la /üîΩthos pa nyung ba ni thos pa phun sum tshogs pa la /üîΩser sna can ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa la / thos pa nyung ba ni thos pa phun sum tshogs pa la / ser sna can ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa la /
translated: Those who are immoral he establishes in perfect morality.üîΩThose who are poorly educated he establishes in perfect learning.üîΩThe miserly he establishes in perfect generosity.

original: shes rab 'chal ba ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa la dgod par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa la dgod par byed do //
translated: The stupid he establishes in perfect wisdom.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du skrag par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du skrag par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the terrorizing, etc. in all its forms.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rnam pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rnam pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he is endowed with morality in the performance of the aims of beings in all their forms.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims thams cad do //
translated: This is all the moralities.

original: dka' ba spyod pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni 'di nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The morality of difficult action and so on are to be known as its divisions.

original: de la dka' ba spyod pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa ni tshegs chen pos bya ba'o //üîΩde la yang dag par len pa dang / srung ba dang / 'khrul pa med pa las @193a * //
analyzed: de la dka' ba spyod pa'i tshul khrims gang yin pa ni tshegs chen pos bya ba'o // de la yang dag par len pa dang / srung ba dang / 'khrul pa med pa las @193a * //
translated: Among them, the morality of difficult action is that which is done with great difficulty.

original: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: And that is threefold:üîΩtaking it up, protecting it, and not erring in it.

original: gang 'di longs spyod chen po dang / dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed cing 'dug pa las longs spyod chen po da dong dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa de rtsa ba dang 'dra bar spangs nas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di longs spyod chen po dang / dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed cing 'dug pa las longs spyod chen po da dong dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa de rtsa ba dang 'dra bar spangs nas tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang /
translated: Taking it up is when one, having abandoned great wealth and great power, takes up the vow of morality.

original: gang yang tshul khrims thams cad blangs nas nyam thag ste srog la thugs kyang tshul khrims de nyams par mi byed na slar yag med par lta ga la byed /
analyzed: gang yang tshul khrims thams cad blangs nas nyam thag ste srog la thugs kyang tshul khrims de nyams par mi byed na slar yag med par lta ga la byed /
translated: Protecting it is when one, having taken up all morality, does not let it decline even at the cost of one's life, much less for any other reason.üîΩNot erring in it is when one, having taken up all morality, does not err in the slightest way, even in jest.

original: gang yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ji nas kyang nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung zhing 'khrul pa yang mi 'byung na lci ba lta bu 'byung bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ji nas kyang nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung zhing 'khrul pa yang mi 'byung na lci ba lta bu 'byung bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: And as long as I live, I will not commit even the slightest fault, nor even a thought of confusion, much less a grave fault.

original: thams cad kyi sgo'i tshul khrims ni khyab pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo'i tshul khrims ni khyab pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The morality of the door of all is the door of all because it pervades all.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: yang dag par blangs pa dang / goms pa dang rang bzhin dang / thabs dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa dang / goms pa dang rang bzhin dang / thabs dang ldan pa'i //
translated: from undertaking, from practice, from nature, and from equipment.

original: de la yang dag par blangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag par blangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, from undertaking is the morality of the bodhisattva from undertaking.

original: goms pa ni sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu yang dag par blangs pa la goms pa'i dbang gis ci nas kyang sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing dge ba nyid la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa ni sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu yang dag par blangs pa la goms pa'i dbang gis ci nas kyang sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' zhing dge ba nyid la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: From practice is the morality of the bodhisattva from the power of practice in previous lives, by which he does not delight in evil, but delights in virtue.

original: rang bzhin ni gang zhig rang bzhin gyis kun du skrag par gnas pas rgyun du yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gang zhig rang bzhin gyis kun du skrag par gnas pas rgyun du yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Morality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug pa'o //üîΩthabs dang ldan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams la lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug pa'o // thabs dang ldan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la brten nas sems can rnams la lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Morality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims ni dam pa kho na'i spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims ni dam pa kho na'i spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Morality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.üîΩMorality is engaged in with a pure body and speech.

analyzed: bdag de lta bu 'dod bzhin du gal te gzhan gyis log par kun du spyod par gyur na /

original: des bdag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: des bdag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: that will be unpleasant for me.

original: gzhan yang de ltar 'dod bzhin du bdag gis log par kun du spyad par gyur na des de dag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar 'dod bzhin du bdag gis log par kun du spyad par gyur na des de dag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If I engage in such misconduct while they desire otherwise, that will be unpleasant for them.

original: gang bdag dang gzhan dag gi yang yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba de dag gis gzhan dag la ci'i phyir kun du spyod par bya snyam pa de @194a * //
analyzed: gang bdag dang gzhan dag gi yang yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba de dag gis gzhan dag la ci'i phyir kun du spyod par bya snyam pa de @194a * //
translated: Why should I engage in that which is disagreeable to myself and others?

original: ltar so sor brtags nas srog gi phyir yang gzhan dag la yid du mi 'ong ba rnam pa brgyad po kun du spyod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltar so sor brtags nas srog gi phyir yang gzhan dag la yid du mi 'ong ba rnam pa brgyad po kun du spyod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, having reflected in this way, he does not engage in the eight kinds of unwholesome conduct even for the sake of his life.

original: tshe 'di dang pha rol du bde bar 'gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag dang gzhan dag skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag tu bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang pha rol du bde bar 'gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag dang gzhan dag skye ba 'di dang skye ba gzhan dag tu bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality that leads to happiness in this life and the next is the cause of happiness in this life and the next for oneself and others.

original: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: It is ninefold:

original: gang 'di sems can dgag par bya ba rnams ni 'gog par byed /
analyzed: gang 'di sems can dgag par bya ba rnams ni 'gog par byed /

original: gnang bar bya ba rnams ni gnang bar byed /

original: sems can bsdu ba rnams ni sdud par byed /
analyzed: sems can bsdu ba rnams ni sdud par byed /
translated: he encourages those who should be encouraged;üîΩhe overpowers those who should be overpowered;

original: tshar gcad par bya ba rnams ni tshar gcod par byed cing lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshar gcad par bya ba rnams ni tshar gcod par byed cing lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: and he disciplines those who should be disciplined.

original: gang yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang ldan pa 'di dag nyid dang / gzhan dag la tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bde bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang ldan pa 'di dag nyid dang / gzhan dag la tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bde bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is also the cause of happiness in this life and the next for those who possess generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom, and for others.

original: rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad bkrus pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad bkrus pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Morality is pure in all ways because it is purified by the bath of stainless morality.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: It has ten aspects:

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is not deficient, because it is undertaken with the desire for the way of virtuous practitioners and for complete enlightenment,

original: 'tsho ba 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang 'gal ba byas pa chung ngu la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin par 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang yang thal ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang 'gal ba byas pa chung ngu la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin par 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang yang thal ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: not with the desire for livelihood. It is not overly slack, because there is no regret for a small transgression from the beginning. It is not overly strained, because there is no regret for a transgression in an inappropriate situation.

original: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su mi len pa dang / nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir le lo dang mi ldan pa dang / sngar bstan pa'i yan lag lnga'i bag yod pa la brten pa'i phyir bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su mi len pa dang / nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir le lo dang mi ldan pa dang / sngar bstan pa'i yan lag lnga'i bag yod pa la brten pa'i phyir bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: They do not indulge in the pleasures of sleep, lying down, and resting, they are not lazy because they are dedicated to virtue day and night, they are endowed with carefulness because they rely on carefulness with regard to the five previously explained branches,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa med pa dang / lha nyid du smon pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par khas blangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon lam legs par btab pa dang / spyod lam dang 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la skyor ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi spyod pa shin tu phun sum chogs shing 'tsham pa'i phyir cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa med pa dang / lha nyid du smon pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par khas blangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon lam legs par btab pa dang / spyod lam dang 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la skyor ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi spyod pa shin tu phun sum chogs shing 'tsham pa'i phyir cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: they are endowed with excellent aspirations because they are not attached to gain and honor and they do not abide in pure conduct through aspiring to be a god and they are endowed with perfect conduct because their physical and verbal conduct is extremely perfect and appropriate in terms of their behavior, immediate actions and perseverance in virtue.

original: tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i @194b phyir 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i sbyor ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i @194b phyir 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i sbyor ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dang /
translated: Because he has completely abandoned all the faults of wrong livelihood such as hypocrisy, he is endowed with perfect livelihood. Because he has abandoned the two extremes of indulging in sensual pleasures and tormenting the body,

original: mu stegs thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir des par 'byin pa dang / nyams par mi byed cing med par mi byed pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs pa ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir des par 'byin pa dang / nyams par mi byed cing med par mi byed pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs pa ma nyams pa'o //
translated: he is a renunciate. Because he has abandoned all the views of the tƒ´rthikas, he is a true renunciate. Because he does not violate and does not destroy his vows, he is one who has not violated his vows.

original: de ltar rnam pa dgu po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dgu po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po ste /

original: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
translated: which produces the fruit of great enlightenment.

original: 'di la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: 'di la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: In dependence on this, the bodhisattva perfects the perfection of morality.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba de srid du 'di byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'di la slob bzhin pa na /
analyzed: ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba de srid du 'di byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'di la slob bzhin pa na /
translated: For as long as they do not fully awaken, for that long, while they are training in this bodhisattva‚Äôs immeasurable aggregate of morality,

original: phan yon rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: they will obtain five benefits.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhig nas kyang gang na de dang tshul khrims mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhig nas kyang gang na de dang tshul khrims mtshungs pa'am /
translated: They will be considered by the buddhas, they will die while abiding in supreme great joy, and after their bodies have fallen apart, they will be reborn in a good place, in a heavenly world.

original: lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra zhing chos mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'gyur ba der skye bar 'gyur ba dang tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med paüîΩdang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims nyid de ;
analyzed: lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra zhing chos mthun pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'gyur ba der skye bar 'gyur ba dang tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims nyid de ;
translated: And in this life he will have immeasurable heaps of merit,üîΩwhich will bring about the perfection of the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims de'i bdag nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims de'i bdag nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And in the next life he will obtain the morality that is natural to his state.

original: de ltar na 'di ni de'i mod la ngan songs du 'gro ba rnam par bcad cing skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni de'i mod la ngan songs du 'gro ba rnam par bcad cing skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, he will not immediately go to the lower realms, but will be reborn in a place where he will have as spiritual benefactors excellent Bodhisattvas who are his equals in potential and who are in accord with him in the practice of the Dharma.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar 'di la 'di 'dra ba'i phan yon ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar 'di la 'di 'dra ba'i phan yon ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could such benefits arise?

original: sems bskyed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is the generation of the Thought,

original: 'di ni ngan song rnam par gcad par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngan song rnam par gcad par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: this is not the desire to eliminate the lower realms.

original: de lta na yang 'di ngan song rnams su skye bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ngan song rnams su skye bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Still, they will not be born in the lower realms.

original: gang gi phyir yang ngan song rnams rnam par ma bcad kyang 'di der skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang ngan song rnams rnam par ma bcad kyang 'di der skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Even though they have not eliminated the lower realms, they do not wish to be born there.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i sems bskyed pa'i phan yon yin par rigs so //üîΩgzhan @195a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i sems bskyed pa'i phan yon yin par rigs so // gzhan @195a * //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that these benefits are from the generation of the thought of awakening.

original: du na sdig pa dang mi ldan pa nyid der mi skye na ni gang zhig gang gi phan yon du 'gyur /
analyzed: du na sdig pa dang mi ldan pa nyid der mi skye na ni gang zhig gang gi phan yon du 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if those who do not possess evil karma are not born there, then who would benefit from it?

original: gang gis de'i mod la ngan song rnam par gcad par 'dod pa yang 'di thams cad du ngan song du skye bar mi 'dod pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de'i mod la ngan song rnam par gcad par 'dod pa yang 'di thams cad du ngan song du skye bar mi 'dod pa nyid kyang ma yin te /

analyzed: thams cad kyis lta ci smos zhes bya ba rgyu dang bcas par byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las gsung par 'gyur ba zhig na /
