original: ma gsungs pa dang gang gi phyir rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa nyid kyis gang du ma nyid yod pa'i dbye bas ltung ba ston par byed pa yin na ni de legs na /
analyzed: ma gsungs pa dang gang gi phyir rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i sdom pa blangs pa nyid kyis gang du ma nyid yod pa'i dbye bas ltung ba ston par byed pa yin na ni de legs na /
translated: If it were to teach downfalls by classifying them in terms of the four castes such as the warrior caste and so on,

original: @200b rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas ltung ba bstan pa cung zad med pas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: @200b rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas ltung ba bstan pa cung zad med pas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: There is no contradiction here, because there is no teaching of downfalls that distinguishes the classes of royalty and so on.üîΩWhat are the downfalls that are causes of losing the lay practitioner‚Äôs precepts?

original: yang pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba de rnams gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba de rnams gang yin zhe na /
translated: The root downfallsüîΩare to take what has not been given,

original: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: rnyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: to engage in sexual misconduct,üîΩto speak falsely, and to speak divisively.

original: rnyed par byed pas na rnyed pa ste /üîΩgos dang zas la sogs pa'o //üîΩbkur sti ni legs par rim gro byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed par byed pas na rnyed pa ste / gos dang zas la sogs pa'o // bkur sti ni legs par rim gro byed pa ste /
translated: To take what has not been given is to steal.üîΩIt is to take the property of others by force or stealth.

original: de dag la chags pa ni de la lhag par zhen pa'o //üîΩbdag ni rang nyid do //
analyzed: de dag la chags pa ni de la lhag par zhen pa'o // bdag ni rang nyid do //
translated: To engage in sexual misconduct is to have sexual relations with those who are protected by their mother, father, brother, sister, relatives, or by law, or with those who are the wives of others, or with animals.üîΩTo speak falsely is to lie about having seen, heard, or understood something that one has not seen, heard, or understood, or to lie about having seen, heard, or understood something that one has seen, heard, or understood.

original: bstod pa ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan gyis stod par byed pa ste /üîΩlog par bstod cing gzhan yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan par grags pa rnams la yang smod pa ste /
analyzed: bstod pa ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan gyis stod par byed pa ste / log par bstod cing gzhan yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan par grags pa rnams la yang smod pa ste /
translated: To speak divisively is to speak in a way that causes division among those who are in agreement, or to speak in a way that increases division among those who are already divided.üîΩTo speak harshly is to speak in a way that causes others to suffer, or to speak in a way that is contemptuous of others.

original: skyon rnams brjod cing smod pa'o //
analyzed: skyon rnams brjod cing smod pa'o //
translated: To speak frivolously is to speak in a way that is not conducive to others‚Äô understanding, or to speak in a way that is not conducive to others‚Äô liberation.

original: 'di skad du yon tan dang ldan par grags pa ni bdag ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du yon tan dang ldan par grags pa ni bdag ste /
translated: To be covetous is to desire the wealth and possessions of others, thinking, ‚ÄúOh, that what belongs to others might belong to me!‚ÄùüîΩTo have ill will is to have a mind of malice toward others, thinking, ‚ÄúMay these sentient beings be killed or cut to pieces! May they be annihilated!‚ÄùüîΩTo have wrong views is to hold a nihilistic view, thinking, ‚ÄúThere is no giving, no sacrifice, no burnt offerings, no good conduct, no bad conduct, and so on up to: there are no arhats in the world.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba rnams bdag la rjed par byed bkur sti byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams bdag la rjed par byed bkur sti byed do //
translated: He is honored and revered by beings.

original: gtong ba dang yongs su gtong ba dag gis mchod par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gtong ba dang yongs su gtong ba dag gis mchod par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He is worshipped through giving and complete giving.üîΩHe praises himself and disparages others, thus he praises himself and disparages others.

original: bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par yang byed pas bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims las da ltar ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ma chags pa las nyams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'iüîΩgnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti dag la shin tu chags pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par yang byed pas bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims las da ltar ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ma chags pa las nyams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti dag la shin tu chags pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is a bodhisattva's defeat-like offense due to degeneration of the morality of restraint, due to attachment to present gain and honor.üîΩA bodhisattva who, through excessive attachment to gain and honor, praises himself and disparages others commits a downfall through indulging in that.

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ni bdag nyid kyis thob pa'i rnyed pa yang gzhan rnams la sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ni bdag nyid kyis thob pa'i rnyed pa yang gzhan rnams la sbyin par byed cing /

original: gsang ba'i chos rnams kyang gzhan la ston par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gsang ba'i chos rnams kyang gzhan la ston par byed pa yin na /
translated: If one teaches the secret Dharmas to others,

original: de ji ltar chags pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar chags pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: how could attachment arise?

original: des na rgyu des bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: des na rgyu des bdag la bstod pa dang gzhan la smod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /

original: bstan pa gnas par 'dod pa'i phyar mu stegs can rnams zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar byed 'dod cing mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par 'dod pa dang / ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba dang /
analyzed: bstan pa gnas par 'dod pa'i phyar mu stegs can rnams zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar byed 'dod cing mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par 'dod pa dang / ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba dang /
translated: If one does so in order to defeat the tirthikas who do not want the teachings to remain, in order to lift those to be trained by that method from nonvirtue and establish them in virtue, in order to generate faith in those who lack it,

analyzed: dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir byed na nyis pa @201a * //

original: med do // don 'di nyid la dgongs nas /
analyzed: med do // don 'di nyid la dgongs nas /
translated: With this very point in mind,üîΩit is said that there is no fault in a virtuous mind

original: snying rjer ldan zhing byams phyir dang // sems dge ba la nyes pa med //
analyzed: snying rjer ldan zhing byams phyir dang // sems dge ba la nyes pa med //
translated: that is compassionate and loving.

original: ces mthar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces mthar 'chad par 'gyur ro //

original: sdug bsngal mgon med ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal ba dang / phongs pa dang / mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa la nor 'dod pa dang / chos 'dod pas legs par slong zhing 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod cing bdog bzhin ba dang /üîΩchos la nges pa thob kyang rang bzhin gyis ser sna dang ldan pas gzhan nye bar 'byor pa la mi bzod pa nyid kyis non te zad zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par 'os pa rnams la mi ster ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mgon med ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal ba dang / phongs pa dang / mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa la nor 'dod pa dang / chos 'dod pas legs par slong zhing 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod cing bdog bzhin ba dang / chos la nges pa thob kyang rang bzhin gyis ser sna dang ldan pas gzhan nye bar 'byor pa la mi bzod pa nyid kyis non te zad zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par 'os pa rnams la mi ster ba ste /
translated: The line those who are suffering, unprotected, and so on refers to those who are suffering, destitute, unprotected, and without refuge, who come to you seeking wealth and the Dharma.üîΩ You have the things to give, but you are stingy by nature and cannot bear others' prosperity. You do not give to those who are worthy of gifts, such as those who are poor and those who are practicing the Dharma.

original: mi gtong ba ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims dag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa las nyams pa'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos gnyis pa'o //

translated: Not giving is the second quality that is likened to a defeat because it undermines the perfection of generosity by undermining the morality of gathering virtue and acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa dang / chos rnams nges pa yin yang legs par don du gnyer zhing 'ongs pa rnams la ser sna chen pos zil gyis non pas nor dang chos mi ster ba na pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa dang / chos rnams nges pa yin yang legs par don du gnyer zhing 'ongs pa rnams la ser sna chen pos zil gyis non pas nor dang chos mi ster ba na pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba byung ba'o //
translated: When a bodhisattva has the things to be given and the Dharma is certain, but out of great stinginess does not give wealth or the Dharma to those who have properly sought them, he incurs an infraction of the vow.

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ni gang gis gzhan bongs shing mngon par 'dod pa dag nye bar rig nas slong bar mi byed kyang bdag nyid kyis pha rol dag nor len du gzhug par byed cing kun du bskul bas kyang chos nyan du gzhug par byed pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur pa ni gang gis gzhan bongs shing mngon par 'dod pa dag nye bar rig nas slong bar mi byed kyang bdag nyid kyis pha rol dag nor len du gzhug par byed cing kun du bskul bas kyang chos nyan du gzhug par byed pa
translated: When a bodhisattva, knowing that others are in need and desire something, does not ask them, but himself gives them wealth, and also encourages others to give, and also encourages others to give the Dharma,üîΩwhat need is there to speak of his giving the Dharma when he is asked?

original: yin no // de ci ltar dgos pa yod cing chos kyi nges pa yod kyang ser snas kun du bcings pas legs par don du gnyer zhing 'ongs pa rnams la slong bar byed na mi ster ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //

translated: When a bodhisattva, though having the need and the Dharma, does not give to those who have properly sought them out of the bonds of stinginess, this is not the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.

original: longs spyod de dag med pas ma byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi nang khrims srung bar 'dod pa dang / thabs nges 'dul bar byed 'dod cing /üîΩmi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par byed pa dang / mi phan zhing ma brtags pa dang / mi phan zhing ma bslang ba dang / de rgyal po la gnad pa yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: longs spyod de dag med pas ma byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi nang khrims srung bar 'dod pa dang / thabs nges 'dul bar byed 'dod cing / mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste dge ba'i gnas su 'jog par byed pa dang / mi phan zhing ma brtags pa dang / mi phan zhing ma bslang ba dang / de rgyal po la gnad pa yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is observing a rule of the Sangha, or if he or she wishes to benefit someone by means of a training rule,üîΩor if he or she wishes to train others by means of a training rule, or if he or she wishes to turn someone away from opportunities nonvirtuous and direct him or her toward opportunities virtuous, or if he or she wishes to stop someone from engaging in wrongful conduct, or if he or she wishes to settle a dispute, or if he or she is observing a rule of the king, such as a law of the country.

original: mu stegs can glags tshol ba dang / ma gus shing zhes med pa dang spyod lam ngan pas gnod pa dang / @201b chos mi len pa dang / dbang po rtul po chos rgya chen po bstan na skrag cing log par lta ba dang / log par mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can glags tshol ba dang / ma gus shing zhes med pa dang spyod lam ngan pas gnod pa dang / @201b chos mi len pa dang / dbang po rtul po chos rgya chen po bstan na skrag cing log par lta ba dang / log par mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: There is no offense if the person is a tƒ´rthika who is seeking an opportunity to discredit the teachings, or if he or she is disrespectful and lacks faith, or if he or she is a person of bad character, or if he or she is someone who will not accept the teachings, or if he or she is someone of dull faculties who will become frightened and lose faith if taught the extensive teachings, or if he or she is someone who is strongly attached to a wrong view, or if he or she is someone who is strongly attached to a wrong path.

original: de'i 'og tu song na gzhan snod du ma gyur pa rnams la chos 'phel ba nyams pa dang / gnod par 'gyur du dogs pa dang / bdag nyid smra mi nus par gyur cing stobs dang mi ldan pa dang / de yang chos 'di la mi 'jug pa la thabs des 'dul bar 'gyur 'dod na lhung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu song na gzhan snod du ma gyur pa rnams la chos 'phel ba nyams pa dang / gnod par 'gyur du dogs pa dang / bdag nyid smra mi nus par gyur cing stobs dang mi ldan pa dang / de yang chos 'di la mi 'jug pa la thabs des 'dul bar 'gyur 'dod na lhung ba med do //
translated: If one goes below that, there is no downfall if one suspects that the Dharma will decline or be harmed among those who are not vessels, or if one is unable to speak or is not strong enough, or if one wishes to train others by that method who are not engaged in this Dharma.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas srog chags gzhan la 'tshog pa ste /üîΩlag pa'am / bong ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pas srog chags gzhan la 'tshog pa ste / lag pa'am / bong ba'am /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúanother,‚Äù etc., it is striking another living being with a mind of anger.üîΩIt is striking with the hand, or with a clod,

original: dbyig pa dag gis rdeg par byed /
analyzed: dbyig pa dag gis rdeg par byed /
translated: or with a stick.

original: rnam par 'tshe bar byed rnam par tho 'tshams par byed la /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe bar byed rnam par tho 'tshams par byed la /
translated: It is harming, it is mistreating.

original: khro ba'i bsam pa kho na zhe la bzung ste /
analyzed: khro ba'i bsam pa kho na zhe la bzung ste /
translated: It is holding an angry thought.

original: gzhan gnod par byed pa rnams kyis bshags kyang ste shad kyis sbyangs kyang mi nyan cing bzod par mi byed la bsam pas mi gtong ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dag la gzhan gyis nyes pa bzod par byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnod par byed pa rnams kyis bshags kyang ste shad kyis sbyangs kyang mi nyan cing bzod par mi byed la bsam pas mi gtong ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dag la gzhan gyis nyes pa bzod par byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos gsum pa'o //
translated: The third quality that is like a root downfall is that, in the morality of restraint and the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, one does not listen to the confession of others‚Äô faults, does not forgive, and does not give up one‚Äôs anger.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khro ba drag pos zil gyis non pas pha rol gyis legs par bshags shing shad kyis sbyangs kyang mi nyan cing mi bzod la rdeg par byed pa ni pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba 'byung ba'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpar gyur pa ni gang gis pha rol gyi nyes par spyad pa shin tu drag cing mched par 'gyur la /

translated: If a bodhisattva, overcome by intense anger, does not listen to and does not forgive the good confession and sincere amendment of the other person, and instead strikes the other person, a root downfall occurs.

original: mang du bya ba la yang bzod par bya zhing /
analyzed: mang du bya ba la yang bzod par bya zhing /
translated: A bodhisattva should forgive the faults of others, even if they are very serious and numerous.

analyzed: rnyed pa'i gnas dang bral bar ri mor bya ba'i sems kyis rab tu dga' ba bskyed par bya ba yin na /

analyzed: 'di na de tsam gyis nyes par spyod pa la yang ci'i phyir de lta bu khro ba yang ji ltar dang du len par byed /

analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig rtsub mo mngon par brjod cing rdeg par byed la ngo tsha med pa'i sems kyis rang nyid ldog par yang mi byed do //
translated: Because one does not stop oneself with a shameless mind, one utters harsh words and strikes.

original: shad kyis sbyang ba byas kyang bag la nyal lam 'ching bar bzod par mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: shad kyis sbyang ba byas kyang bag la nyal lam 'ching bar bzod par mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: Even if one is scratched with fingernails, one does not tolerate it, thinking this is not the Dharma of a bodhisattva.

original: thabs des 'dul bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin du nyes pa med pa yin no //üîΩtheg pa chen @202a * //

analyzed: po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi ma mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the mother of the bodhisattva canon, etc.

original: spong byed ni skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: spong byed ni skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The rejection is the denial.

original: dam chos 'drar snang ni de'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos la gzhan gyi g-yam la yang rung ste /
analyzed: dam chos 'drar snang ni de'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos la gzhan gyi g-yam la yang rung ste /
translated: The semblance of the true Dharma is the teaching of a counterfeit Dharma, which is like a reflection of the true Dharma.

original: ston pa dang 'jog pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi lta ba ngan pa spong ba la sogs pa'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang 'jog pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi lta ba ngan pa spong ba la sogs pa'i phyir pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos bzhi pa'o //

translated: There are only three, not two or one, in front of whom one confesses.

original: nyung ba nyid kyis tha mal ba la sogs pa bzhin du ltung ba las ldang ba'i las byas su zin kyang ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyung ba nyid kyis tha mal ba la sogs pa bzhin du ltung ba las ldang ba'i las byas su zin kyang ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were fewer, then even though one has performed the action of rising from the transgression, it would be as if one had not, like a layperson who has violated the precepts.

original: de las lhag par yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gsum las lhag pa ste bzhi la sogs pa'i mdun du ste /
analyzed: de las lhag par yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gsum las lhag pa ste bzhi la sogs pa'i mdun du ste /

analyzed: lhag pa nyid kyis legs par byas pa'i phyir ro // gcig gi mdun du zhes bya ba 'di la yang gi sgreng blta bar bya ste /

original: bshags par bye zhas 'dir nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshags par bye zhas 'dir nges par gzung bar bya'o //

original: 'di'i don ni gcig gi mdun du yang ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gcig gi mdun du yang ste /

analyzed: gnyis la sogs pa 'ba' @204a * //üîΩzhig la bshags par bya ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: thub pa'i bka' ni rim pa dang bral ba ma yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: rig par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: ltung ba gzhan rnams ni bshags par yang bya zhes bya bar rig par bya la /

analyzed: gal te zag pa 'bring yang bsdams par gyur na de'i tshe gsum mam /
translated: If the medium defilements are also restrained, then at that time there would be three or

analyzed: de las ltag pa'i gang zag gi grangs dgos pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if there is no person, then the number of persons is not necessary.

analyzed: du ma la bshags pa'ang rung ste /

analyzed: @204b de'i phyir ji skad bstan pa nyid ni rigs pa yin no //

translated: Seeing it just like that, the author of the sutra

analyzed: zag pa 'bring ni gsum la bshags //
translated: Confesses the medium defilements to three,

original: gcig gi mdun du lhag ma rnams //
analyzed: gcig gi mdun du lhag ma rnams //

original: nyon mongs mi mongs bdag sems la //
analyzed: nyon mongs mi mongs bdag sems la //

original: zhes mdo gsum po so sor bstan pa yin no //üîΩgzhan du na bdag nyid chen po thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa blo gros rnam par dag pas de ji srid kun du rmongs pa'am /

analyzed: chi ga la mi mkhas pas de lta bu'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: Otherwise, the great being, endowed with great compassion, with pure intellect, would not teach such a meaning, for how could he be ignorant?

original: shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: shin tu spros pas chog go //

analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ltung ba 'di gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: le lo dang / snyom las dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa la sogs pas byung ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: A downfall that is motivated by laziness, idleness, carelessness, or forgetfulness is an unafflicted downfall.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa las gzhan pa la ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa las gzhan pa la ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yin la /

analyzed: 'di la snyom las dang le lo la sogs pa byed pa ni nyon mongs pa can du dgongs pa'o //

original: de la kun nas mnar sems ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas mnar sems ni 'khrug pa'o //

original: khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //

original: le lo ni dge ba la mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: le lo ni dge ba la mi spro ba'o //

analyzed: snyom las ni byed par mi 'dod pas lus dang sems snyom pa'o //

original: chags pa khong khro nga rgyal sogs //
analyzed: chags pa khong khro nga rgyal sogs //

original: nyon mongs ltung bar 'dir bstan te //
analyzed: nyon mongs ltung bar 'dir bstan te //

analyzed: le lo brjed ngas la sogs pa //

original: mchod las gzhan du nyon mongs min //
analyzed: mchod las gzhan du nyon mongs min //

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //

original: yang de las gzhan pa'i ldang ba'i cho ga rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i ltung ba de rnams gang yin zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa'i ldang ba'i cho ga rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i ltung ba de rnams gang yin zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: Again, it is asked, What are those downfalls taught as the two types of rising from them?

original: nyes byas kyi ltung ba bzhi bcu rtsa drug rgyu ji lta ba'i rim pas bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: nyes byas kyi ltung ba bzhi bcu rtsa drug rgyu ji lta ba'i rim pas bstan par 'dod nas /

original: dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: dkon mchog gsum la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun te /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun te /
translated: The three jewels are the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: dkon mchog gsum po rnams la gsum ste /üîΩ@205a * // lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mchod par mi byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis dus dus su rgya che ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i nyes byas kyi
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po rnams la gsum ste / @205a * // lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis mchod par mi byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis dus dus su rgya che ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i nyes byas kyi
translated: There are three types of jewels:

original: gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not making offerings to the three jewels with body, speech, and mind is a bodhisattva's minor offense like a downfall, because it is a degeneration of making offerings to the three jewels with body, speech, and mind in a timely way with vast forms of virtue through the ethics of gathering virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / don dam pa'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa'i glegs bam dang / phyogs bcu'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa la ci 'byor ba'i me tog la sogs pas mchod par bya ste /üîΩtha na lus kyis phyag gcig tsam 'tshal ba dang / ngag gis de rnams kyi yon tan rnams las brtsams te tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam 'don pa dang / sems kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dad pa gcig tsam yang ma byas par ma gus pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / don dam pa'i chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la sogs pa'i glegs bam dang / phyogs bcu'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun gang yin pa la ci 'byor ba'i me tog la sogs pas mchod par bya ste / tha na lus kyis phyag gcig tsam 'tshal ba dang / ngag gis de rnams kyi yon tan rnams las brtsams te tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam 'don pa dang / sems kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dad pa gcig tsam yang ma byas par ma gus pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva should make offerings to the stupas of the Lord Buddhas, to the images of the Buddha, to the ultimate Dharma, to the books of the Bodhisattva Canon, and to the Sangha of the bodhisattvas in the ten directions, with whatever flowers, etc., he can obtain.

original: snyom las dang le los nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyom las dang le los nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not make offerings to them even with one prostration with his body, or with one verse of four lines beginning with the good qualities of those objects, or with one thought preceded by faith in their good qualities, but instead passes the time with disrespect, laziness, and idleness, he commits an offense with affliction.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sar chud pas mchod pa'i mchog gis mchod par byed na nyes pa med do ;
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sar chud pas mchod pa'i mchog gis mchod par byed na nyes pa med do ;
translated: There is no offense if one has entered the stage of pure thought and worships with the highest worship.

original: ;'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ;'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a mind of desire‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i sems ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la 'chums pa dang / ma thob pa la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la 'chums pa dang / ma thob pa la chags pa'o //
translated: A mind of desire is a mind that is attached to gain and honor, and is attached to what has not been obtained.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: To follow that is to pursue it.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis shin tu bsdams pa'i tshul khrims las rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang du mi len cing 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis shin tu bsdams pa'i tshul khrims las rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang du mi len cing 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Because it causes one to fall away from the morality of restraint by the code of rules, from the morality of collecting virtuous dharmas, and from the morality of working the welfare of sentient beings, it is a dharmic offense similar to a defeat.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa'i sems bskyed pa dang du len par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod pa'i sems bskyed pa dang du len par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva accepts the arising of a mind of desire, it is an offense of reactivity.

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sems pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i sems pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: But if it is a mind of desire that is not reactive, there is no offense, because it is naturally reactive.

original: spang bar 'dod kyang nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir zol gyis mnan nas 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: spang bar 'dod kyang nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir zol gyis mnan nas 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though he wishes to avoid them, there is no fault if he enters into them by the force of strong defilements.

original: rgan pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rgan pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: With regard to the elder, etc.,

original: ches rgan pa la gus par mi byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul @205b khrims kyis shin du bsdams pa'i tshul khrims las spyod pa dag las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i ches rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan pa la bkur sti bya bar 'os pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i chos gang zag mthong na nga rgyal gyis sam /
analyzed: ches rgan pa la gus par mi byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul @205b khrims kyis shin du bsdams pa'i tshul khrims las spyod pa dag las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa'i ches rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan pa la bkur sti bya bar 'os pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i chos gang zag mthong na nga rgyal gyis sam /
translated: it is a Dharma-like offense for one who is very restrained by the morality of restraint to transgress the morality of the rite by not showing respect to one who is much older.

original: khong khro ba la sogs pas gus par mi byed cing stan las mi ldang la stan mi stobs na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba la sogs pas gus par mi byed cing stan las mi ldang la stan mi stobs na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees a person who is a Bodhisattva, older, and endowed with good qualities, who is worthy of respect, and who is in accord with the Dharma, and if one does not show respect out of pride or out of anger, etc., and does not rise from one's seat or offer one's seat, it is an offense with defilement.

original: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Laziness, etc., are without defilement.

original: nad tshabs che bas nus pa chung ba dang / tha mal pa ma yin pa dang sems 'khrugs pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nad tshabs che bas nus pa chung ba dang / tha mal pa ma yin pa dang sems 'khrugs pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is sick and unable to respond; if the questioner is not a normal person, but insane, etc.; or if the bodhisattva is in a meditative concentration.

original: dris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: dris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif asked‚Äù and so on.

original: dris pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /üîΩkun du smra ba dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dris pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste / kun du smra ba dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúasked‚Äù is a synecdoche for ‚Äúif asked a question.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúif he or she does not respond‚Äù is a synecdoche for ‚Äúif he or she does not respond by speaking or by causing delight.‚Äù

original: lan 'debs pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i lan mi 'debs pa'o //üîΩ'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i lan mi 'debs pa'o // 'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
