original: dman pas kun du 'tsho ba ni log par 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: dman pas kun du 'tsho ba ni log par 'tsho ba ste /
translated: Wrong livelihood is the means of livelihood that is inferior.

original: 'tsho ba log par byed pa'i chos ni 'tsho ba log pa'o zhes bya bar nye bar btags nas bstan @209b pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba log par byed pa'i chos ni 'tsho ba log pa'o zhes bya bar nye bar btags nas bstan @209b pa'o //
translated: It is taught by the prefix ‚Äúmis‚Äù as if it were a term for the Dharma of wrong livelihood.

original: de yang chags pa las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: de yang chags pa las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: Moreover, it is the karma of body and speech that arises from attachment.

original: de yang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa dang / chang dang mtshon cha dang dug dang / srog chags dang / rgya skyegs dang 'bru mar la sogs pa 'tshong ba dang /
analyzed: de yang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa dang / chang dang mtshon cha dang dug dang / srog chags dang / rgya skyegs dang 'bru mar la sogs pa 'tshong ba dang /
translated: Hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, seeking gain through gain, and selling alcohol, weapons, poison, animals, and sesame oil, etc.

original: ma brtags pa'i til dang nyungs kar 'tshir ba'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i til dang nyungs kar 'tshir ba'o //
translated: and pressing sesame and mustard seed without examining them.

original: gang yang zhing la sogs pa ni smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gang yang zhing la sogs pa ni smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention fields, etc.?

original: de lta bu'i log par 'tsho ba dang du len par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'tsho ba dag las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i log par 'tsho ba dang du len par byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi 'tsho ba dag las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Since one who accepts such wrong livelihood falls from the livelihood of the morality of restraint, it is a Dharma that is like a fault.

original: byang chub sems dpa' log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos byung ba rnams dang du len cing mi 'dzem la sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' log pas 'tsho bar byed pa'i chos byung ba rnams dang du len cing mi 'dzem la sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva accepts and does not avoid or remove wrong livelihood when it occurs, he acquires an afflicted fault.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed kyang des slar zil gyis mnan pas kun du spyad pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed kyang des slar zil gyis mnan pas kun du spyad pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though one generates the will to eliminate it, there is no fault in the practice of being overcome by it.

original: 'phyar gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'phyar gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase arrogance, etc. refers to:

original: 'phyar ba ni kun du rgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phyar ba ni kun du rgod pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is excitation.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni kun du rtse ba dang kun du ca co 'don pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni kun du rtse ba dang kun du ca co 'don pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes playfulness and frivolity.

original: rgod pa ste rnam par ma zhi ba'i sems kyis rab tu rgod pa la sogs pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgod pa ma yin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: rgod pa ste rnam par ma zhi ba'i sems kyis rab tu rgod pa la sogs pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgod pa ma yin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: The excitation of a mind that is not calm, such as the excitation of being over-excited, etc., is a Dharma that is similar to a fault, because it is a degeneration of the morality of restraint.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgod pas gzhan dag rgod du gzhug par 'dod cing /üîΩches rgod par byed rtse bar byed ca co 'don par byed du gzhug par 'dod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgod pas gzhan dag rgod du gzhug par 'dod cing / ches rgod par byed rtse bar byed ca co 'don par byed du gzhug par 'dod cing /
translated: If a bodhisattva, being excited, wishes to cause others to be excited,üîΩ and if he wishes to cause them to be more excited, to play, to be frivolous, and to talk in various ways,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pas smra bar byed 'dod na nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pas smra bar byed 'dod na nyon mongs pa can gyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits a misdeed with defilement.

original: brjed ngas pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not defiled, because it is not forgotten.

original: de bsal bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas kun du spyod pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bsal bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas kun du spyod pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one wishes to dispel it, but one does not overcome it, and one does not indulge in it.

original: gzhan dag gis kun nas mnar sems sam mya ngan skyes pa bsal bar 'dod pa dang / rtsed mo la dga' ba'i rang bzhin can rnams bsdu ba dang / 'dun par byed pa rnams kyi sems bsrung ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba rnams mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kun nas mnar sems sam mya ngan skyes pa bsal bar 'dod pa dang / rtsed mo la dga' ba'i rang bzhin can rnams bsdu ba dang / 'dun par byed pa rnams kyi sems bsrung ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba rnams mi dga' ba dang /
translated: There is no fault if one wishes to dispel the hostility or sorrow of others, or if one is protecting the minds of those who delight in play, or of those who are attracted to others, or if one is protecting the minds of followers who might become disaffected, hostile, or turn away from the Dharma.

original: kun nas mnar sems pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur du dogs pa rnams bdag nyid la mngon du phyogs pa dang / bsam pa dag pas kun du smra ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems pa dang / rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur du dogs pa rnams bdag nyid la mngon du phyogs pa dang / bsam pa dag pas kun du smra ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one is speaking with a pure intention, or if one is speaking in order to turn someone away from evil.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: As for the line ‚Äúin cyclic existence, etc.,‚Äù

original: 'khor ba la sems mngon par dga' ba nyid @210a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba la sems mngon par dga' ba nyid @210a * //
translated: one is not attached to cyclic existence because one is not attached to the pleasure of cyclic existence.

original: ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi gcig tu rab tu dben par gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi gcig tu rab tu dben par gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: It is a Dharma that is like a basis for a wrong-doing, because it causes a bodhisattva to fall away from delighting in living in complete solitude, which is the morality of restraint.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das par mngon par dga' bas gnas par mi bya'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' ni mya ngan las 'das par mngon par dga' bas gnas par mi bya'i //
translated: A bodhisattva should not live with a delight in nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis phyogs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis phyogs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should live with his back turned on nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be afraid of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: de dag la sems kyang shin tu dben par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la sems kyang shin tu dben par mi bya ste /
translated: He should not be completely isolated from them.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du 'khor ba na 'khor zhing byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par bya dgos so snyam du de ltar lta zhing de skad sma na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du 'khor ba na 'khor zhing byang chub yang dag par bsgrub par bya dgos so snyam du de ltar lta zhing de skad sma na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva thinks and says, ‚ÄúI must live in cyclic existence for three measureless kalpas in order to achieve enlightenment,‚Äù then he has a reactive thought and a wrong view.

original: nyan thos kyang re zhig bdag gcig pu'i don du mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mngon par dga' bar kun tu ston par byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyang re zhig bdag gcig pu'i don du mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mngon par dga' bar kun tu ston par byed cing /
translated: The listeners, for their part, demonstrate their exclusive delight in nirvana for their own sake alone.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang skyo bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang skyo bar byed pa yin na /
translated: Even the ≈õrƒÅvakas, for the sake of their own liberation, are seen to delight in nirvƒÅ·πáa and to be disenchanted with the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir byung ba 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir byung ba 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: How much more so for the bodhisattva who has appeared for the sake of all sentient beings?

original: 'dis de lta bu'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la goms par bya ba yang dag par bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: 'dis de lta bu'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la goms par bya ba yang dag par bsgrub dgos te /
translated: He should accomplish the familiarization with that kind of mind that is free from the afflictions.

original: de ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ma yin du zin kyang de las khyad par du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ma yin du zin kyang de las khyad par du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even though he is not an arhat, he is superior to them in being free from the afflictions, and he cuts off the contaminated things.

original: ji skad du //üîΩmgo la sems can khur chen khyer ba yi //
analyzed: ji skad du // mgo la sems can khur chen khyer ba yi //
translated: As it is said:

original: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
analyzed: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
translated: The supreme being who carries the great burden of sentient beings on his head does not move slowly.

original: bdag gzhan sna tshogs 'ching bas rab bcings pa //
analyzed: bdag gzhan sna tshogs 'ching bas rab bcings pa //
translated: Bound by the various bonds of self and other,

original: brtson pa brgya 'gyur du ni bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: brtson pa brgya 'gyur du ni bya ba'i rigs //
translated: you should make a hundredfold effort.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said,

original: grags pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: grags pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Not infamy and so on.

original: grags pa ma yin pa ni bsngags pa ma yin bsgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa ma yin pa ni bsngags pa ma yin bsgrogs pa'o //
translated: Infamy is the proclamation of dispraise.

original: de mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: de mi spong ba ste /
translated: Not to avoid that isüîΩto not take care of others.

original: rjes su 'dzin pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi dran pa dang shes bzhin du spyod pa las nyams pa dang / bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams yongs su shes shing nges par mthong ba dang / nges par bstan pa rnam pa lnga las yang dang yang du ma gus gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi dran pa dang shes bzhin du spyod pa las nyams pa dang / bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams yongs su shes shing nges par mthong ba dang / nges par bstan pa rnam pa lnga las yang dang yang du ma gus gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: To not take care of others is to be lax in the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, to be lax in the practice of mindfulness and vigilance, to not fully understand and see one's own errors, and to not be taught the five kinds of things to be taught.

original: byang chub @210b sems dpa' bdag gi tshig mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i gtam ngan pa bden pa'i dngos po sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub @210b sems dpa' bdag gi tshig mi btsun par 'gyur ba'i gtam ngan pa bden pa'i dngos po sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva does not remove the true basis of a bad report that would make him contemptible, he comes to have an afflicted offense.

original: bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //üîΩrab tu byung ba dang / slong mo spyod pa'i rgyus mi snyan par brjod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can mngon par zhen pa'am //
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa sel bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o // rab tu byung ba dang / slong mo spyod pa'i rgyus mi snyan par brjod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can mngon par zhen pa'am //
translated: If one does not reject what is not a real entity, it is not defiled.

original: khro bas zil gyis non cing sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas mi snyan par brjod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: khro bas zil gyis non cing sems phyin ci log tu gyur pas mi snyan par brjod na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one speaks unpleasantly because of being a renunciate or because of practicing mendicancy, or if one speaks unpleasantly because of being overwhelmed by anger and having a distorted mind, there is no offense.

original: nyon mongs pa bcas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If one does not correct, etc. means:

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni drag po'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni drag po'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, with defilement means with intense application.

original: de 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi 'jam pa'i sbyor bas kyang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi 'jam pa'i sbyor bas kyang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: Not only that, but also with gentle application is the meaning of the word also.

original: 'chos par mi byed pa ni nyes par snang bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'chos par mi byed pa ni nyes par snang bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: Does not correct means does not appear to be at fault.

original: rigs pas ston par mi byed cing sma 'bebs par mi byed na sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga las yang dang yang du ma gus par gyur pas 'khrul pa la phan pa'i bsam pas sma dbab pas dran parüîΩbyed du gzhug pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: rigs pas ston par mi byed cing sma 'bebs par mi byed na sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi rjes su bstan pa rnam pa lnga las yang dang yang du ma gus par gyur pas 'khrul pa la phan pa'i bsam pas sma dbab pas dran par byed du gzhug pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: If he does not instruct them with reasoning and does not reproach them, he fails to admonish them with the five kinds of morality that accomplish the aims of beings. He fails to cause them to remember their errors with the intention of helping them, and so he commits an offense similar to a transgression.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag yid mi bde bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir 'jam pa dang drag pa'i thabs dag gis ston par mi byed cing yal bar dor na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag yid mi bde bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir 'jam pa dang drag pa'i thabs dag gis ston par mi byed cing yal bar dor na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not instruct them with gentle and harsh measures in order to protect other bodhisattvas from becoming unhappy, he commits an offense of wrongdoing due to his desire to protect the minds of others.

original: thabs drag po dag gis kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs drag po dag gis kyang gzhan dag la bstan par bya'o //
translated: He should instruct others with harsh measures.

original: gal te de ltar don 'di dag bstan pas na 'di rnams yid mi bde ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar don 'di dag bstan pas na 'di rnams yid mi bde ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not do so, there is no offense if, by teaching these subjects, he would make others unhappy, or if he is ill and so forth.

original: bstan pa'i don zab pa'i rgyus yid mi bde ba chen por gyur na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don zab pa'i rgyus yid mi bde ba chen por gyur na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Even if there is great mental distress due to the profundity of the meaning of the teaching, there is no fault.

original: gshe la lan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gshe la lan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In response to abuse, etc., it is said:

original: gshe bar byed pa la slar gshe ba ni lan du gshe ba'o //
analyzed: gshe bar byed pa la slar gshe ba ni lan du gshe ba'o //
translated: In response to abuse, one should speak pleasantly.

original: stsogs pa'i sgra ni slar khro ba dang slar brdeg pa dang slar mchad 'dru ba dang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgra ni slar khro ba dang slar brdeg pa dang slar mchad 'dru ba dang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The word etc. includes in response to anger, beating, and threatening.

original: slar gshe ba bzhin du slar khro ba la sogs pa la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slar gshe ba bzhin du slar khro ba la sogs pa la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in response to abuse, one should speak pleasantly, and similarly in response to anger, etc.

original: gang slar khro ba la sogs pa de rnams ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dag gis gzhan la phan pa don du gnyer ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gang slar khro ba la sogs pa de rnams ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dag gis gzhan la phan pa don du gnyer ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Those that are in response to anger, etc. are dharmas that are like bases of wrong conduct because they cause one to fall away from seeking to benefit others through the morality of restraint and the morality of acquiring good.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la @211a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la @211a * //
translated: For the bodhisattva,

original: gzhan dag gshe ba dang / khro ba dang / brdegs pa dang / mtshang 'dru bar byed pa dag la khro bas zil gyis non pas slar brnyas par 'dod pas slar gshe bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag gshe ba dang / khro ba dang / brdegs pa dang / mtshang 'dru bar byed pa dag la khro bas zil gyis non pas slar brnyas par 'dod pas slar gshe bar byed /
translated: When others scold, get angry, beat, or insult them, they are overcome by anger and in turn want to insult them, so they scold in return.

original: slar khro bar byed /üîΩslar rdeg par byed /
analyzed: slar khro bar byed / slar rdeg par byed /
translated: They get angry in return.üîΩThey beat in return.

original: slar mtshang 'dru bar byed na /
analyzed: slar mtshang 'dru bar byed na /
translated: They insult in return.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a defiled offense.

original: khros pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khros pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: When angry people...

original: gzhan dag khros shing 'khrugs pa rnams kyang yal bar 'jog cing bzod pa gsol bar mi byed la /üîΩshad kyis sbyong bar mi byed pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims 'chal ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan dag khros shing 'khrugs pa rnams kyang yal bar 'jog cing bzod pa gsol bar mi byed la / shad kyis sbyong bar mi byed pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims 'chal ba'i gzhir gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir //
translated: When others are angry and upset, they do not ignore them and ask for forgiveness.

original: nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: They do not make amends. This is a fault-like quality, because it is a transgression of the morality of gathering virtue, since it does not take up the afflictions and secondary afflictions that are the basis of immorality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la nyes pa byas sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la nyes pa byas sam /
translated: When a bodhisattva has committed an offense against other bodhisattvas,

original: nyes pa byas su dogs kyang rung /
analyzed: nyes pa byas su dogs kyang rung /
translated: Even if one is afraid of committing a fault,

original: kun nas mnar sems kyis sam nga rgyal gyis non pas mthun par shad kyis sbyong bar mi byed de yal bar 'dor na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyis sam nga rgyal gyis non pas mthun par shad kyis sbyong bar mi byed de yal bar 'dor na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: if one does not purify by means of confession because one is overcome by malice or pride, then one is at fault with defilement.

original: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one does not purify because of laziness, etc., one is at fault without defilement.

original: thabs des 'dul bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can yin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can yin pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun du spyod pas shad kyis sbyong bar byed du 'jug par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: thabs des 'dul bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can yin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can yin pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun du spyod pas shad kyis sbyong bar byed du 'jug par 'dod pa dang /
translated: If one does not purify because one wishes to discipline by that means, or because the other is a non-Buddhist, or because the other is naturally quarrelsome, or because one wishes to make the other purify by means of a confession that involves a serious offense,

original: shad kyis sbyang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te shed skye bar 'gyur ba dang / pha rol bzod pa'i dang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la /
analyzed: shad kyis sbyang bar byas na shas cher 'khrugs te shed skye bar 'gyur ba dang / pha rol bzod pa'i dang tshul can yin zhing kun nas mnar sems med pa'i ngang tshul can yin du re la /
translated: or because one thinks that if one purifies by means of confession, the other will become more quarrelsome, or because one hopes that the other is patient and has a forgiving nature,

original: gzhan shad kyis sbyong bar byed pas shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig na nyes pa med do //üîΩpha rol shad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan shad kyis sbyong bar byed pas shin tu ngo tsha bar byed pa zhig na nyes pa med do // pha rol shad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: But if it is done by way of a reprimand, there is no offense.

original: 'ga' zhig la yid du mi 'ong ba'i rgyus gzhan dag gis sbyong bar byed pa spong ba ni nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa byung ba 'ga' zhig las gzhan dag la 'khrugs pas de rnams dus su chos bzhin du shad kyis sbyong bar byed kyang kun nas mnar sems sam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la yid du mi 'ong ba'i rgyus gzhan dag gis sbyong bar byed pa spong ba ni nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' rtsod pa byung ba 'ga' zhig las gzhan dag la 'khrugs pas de rnams dus su chos bzhin du shad kyis sbyong bar byed kyang kun nas mnar sems sam /
translated: If he does not listen to a reprimand, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shad kyis sbyong ba mi nyan na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas shad kyis sbyong ba mi nyan na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva, in a dispute between two others, does not listen to a reprimand from one of them, with a hostile or malicious attitude, then he has an offense of wrongdoing.

original: mi bzod pa'i @211b ngang tshul can yin zhing nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i @211b ngang tshul can yin zhing nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not patient, but he is not morally corrupted.

original: thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can yin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can yin pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par shad kyis sbyong bar byed na nyes pa med do //üîΩkhro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can yin pa dang / rang bzhin gyis 'thab krol can yin pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par shad kyis sbyong bar byed na nyes pa med do // khro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is desirous of disciplining the other by that means, or if the other is a tƒ´rthika, or if the other is naturally quarrelsome, or if the bodhisattva is not acting out of a sense of personal advantage, or if he or she is acting at an inappropriate time.

original: khro ba'i sems kyis rjes su 'jug pa ste /üîΩkun du 'dzin na 'das ma thag pa bzhin du nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa byung ba dang du len par byed /
analyzed: khro ba'i sems kyis rjes su 'jug pa ste / kun du 'dzin na 'das ma thag pa bzhin du nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag la khro ba'i bsam pa byung ba dang du len par byed /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a mind of anger‚Äù means that the bodhisattva is not free of animosity.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúif he or she acquiesces to it‚Äù means that the bodhisattva does not reject it.

original: 'dzin par byed rjes su 'jug par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed rjes su 'jug par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva acquiesces to, or consents to, or follows a thought of anger that has arisen toward other bodhisattvas, he or she commits an offense and a transgression, and acquires an afflicted offense.

original: de spang bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas mngon du rgyu ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de spang bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas mngon du rgyu ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: However, if a bodhisattva is unable to overcome that thought and it continues to manifest, he or she does not commit an offense.

original: bsnyen bkur 'dod phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur 'dod phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúout of a desire for gain or honor‚Äù means

original: bsnyen bkur gyi ched du 'khor rnams sdud pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur gyi ched du 'khor rnams sdud pa ste /
translated: He gathers a retinue for the sake of service and honor.

original: tshogs sdud par byed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi chos bzhin du tshogs yongs su sdud pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: tshogs sdud par byed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi chos bzhin du tshogs yongs su sdud pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma that is like a basis for an offense is the gathering of a retinue, because it is a degeneration of the morality of working for the welfare of living beings, since it is a degeneration of the gathering of the stores.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur la yongs su zhen pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur la yongs su zhen pas zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis 'khor sdud par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva gathers a retinue with a mind that is attached to service and honor, and with a mind that is attached to material things, he commits an offense with affliction.

original: snying brtse bas sdud par byed pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa'i rim gro dang bsnyen bkur bdag gir byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: snying brtse bas sdud par byed pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pa'i rim gro dang bsnyen bkur bdag gir byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he gathers a retinue out of compassion, and if he accepts service and honor that is appropriate.

original: le lo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Laziness, etc.

original: le lo ni lus dang sems kyi snyom pa'o //
analyzed: le lo ni lus dang sems kyi snyom pa'o //
translated: Laziness is the slackness of body and mind.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni snyom las dang gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba rnams bsdu ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni snyom las dang gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba rnams bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the pleasures of laziness, sleep, lying down, and reclining.

original: de dag sel bar mi byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: de dag sel bar mi byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not to dispel these is a form of faulty conduct that resembles a transgression because it constitutes a failure of the perfection of morality that is comprised by the practice of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' le lo dang snyom las skyes te /üîΩgnyid kyi bde ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' le lo dang snyom las skyes te / gnyid kyi bde ba'am /
translated: If a bodhisattva, out of laziness and indolence,üîΩindulges in the pleasures of sleep,

original: nyal ba'i bde ba'am /üîΩglos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dag dus ma yin pa dang / tshod mi 'dzin par nyams su myong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩna ste mi nus pa dang / lam gyis dub pa dang / dus su dang tshod zin pas nyams su myong @212a * //
analyzed: nyal ba'i bde ba'am / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dag dus ma yin pa dang / tshod mi 'dzin par nyams su myong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro // na ste mi nus pa dang / lam gyis dub pa dang / dus su dang tshod zin pas nyams su myong @212a * //
translated: the pleasures of lying down,üîΩor the pleasures of reclining at the wrong time and in an excessive manner, he or she commits an offense that is an act of wrongdoing that is emotionally tainted.

original: bar byed pa dang / de spang bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas kun du spyod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bar byed pa dang / de spang bar 'dod kyang zil gyis non pas kun du spyod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if is ill and unable to do otherwise, if is exhausted from travel, if he or she indulges in these pleasures at the proper time and in moderation,üîΩor if he or she is desirous of abandoning them but is overpowered by them and continues to indulge.

original: chags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The line through attachment, etc. means:

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyis dus 'da' bar byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas kyang gtam ngan pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyis dus 'da' bar byed pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas kyang gtam ngan pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: To pass the time in idle talk is a Dharma that is like a basis for a wrong-doing, because it is a degeneration from the morality of restraint, since one lives in a crowd and does not avoid bad talk.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du chags pas bre mo'i gtam la brten pas dus 'da' bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du chags pas bre mo'i gtam la brten pas dus 'da' bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva passes the time in idle talk through attachment, it is an emotionally tainted offense.

original: brjed ngas pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is through absentmindedness, it is not emotionally tainted.

original: pha rol po'i ngor skad cig tsam nyan pa dang / ya mtshan du 'dzin te 'dri ba dang / dris pa'i lan 'debs pa tsam la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol po'i ngor skad cig tsam nyan pa dang / ya mtshan du 'dzin te 'dri ba dang / dris pa'i lan 'debs pa tsam la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one listens for a moment to the other person, or if one listens out of curiosity, or if one answers a question.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The line through concentration, etc. means:

original: gdams ngag ces bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag ces bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The word instruction is left out in the second instance.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi don mi tshol ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi don la sems gnas par 'dod la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi don mi tshol ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi don la sems gnas par 'dod la /
translated: Not seeking the meaning of meditative concentration is a Dharma that is like a basis for wrong action, because it is a falling away from striving to accomplish the meditative concentration of the morality of vows.

original: khong khro ba dang nga rgyal gyis non pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi thad du gdams ngag tshol du mi 'gro na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang nga rgyal gyis non pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi thad du gdams ngag tshol du mi 'gro na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva, desiring to stabilize his mind on the meaning of meditative concentration, does not go to a spiritual teacher to seek instruction, being overcome by anger and pride, then he has an afflicted fault.

original: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //üîΩna ste mi nus pa dang / gdams ngag log par byung du dogs pa dang / bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin te sems mnyam par 'jog nus sam //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o // na ste mi nus pa dang / gdams ngag log par byung du dogs pa dang / bdag nyid mang du thos pa yin te sems mnyam par 'jog nus sam //
translated: Laziness and so on are not afflicted.

original: gdams ngag gis gdams par bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gdams ngag gis gdams par bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one is sick and unable, or if one fears that the instruction will be wrongly received, or if one is oneself learned and able to stabilize the mind, or if the instruction has already been given and received.

original: bsam gtan sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan sgrib pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The obscurations to meditative concentration, and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i sgrib pa dang du len pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtog pa ngan pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa dang du len par mi byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i sgrib pa dang du len pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi rtog pa ngan pa dang du mi len pa las nyams pa dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa dang du len par mi byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Accepting the hindrances to the application of concentration is a transgression of the morality of vow because it is a falling away from not accepting bad thoughts, and it is a transgression of the morality of collecting virtuous factors because it is a falling away from not accepting the addictions of meditative equipoise.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sbyor bas bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa ste bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod @212b ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sbyor bas bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa ste bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod @212b ba dang /
translated: The hindrances to the application of concentration are the factors that become obstacles to the bodhisattva's concentration: desire for sense-objects, malice, torpor, sleep, excitement, regret,

original: the tshom ste /
analyzed: the tshom ste /
translated: and doubt.

original: de rnams byung ba nyams su myong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams byung ba nyams su myong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one experiences their occurrence, there is a defiled fault.

original: de spang bar 'dod kyang nyon mongs pa drag pos zil gyis non te kun du spyod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de spang bar 'dod kyang nyon mongs pa drag pos zil gyis non te kun du spyod na nyes pa med do //
translated: But if one wishes to eliminate them, and yet is overwhelmed by strong addictions and continues to indulge in them, there is no fault.

original: bsam gtan ro la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan ro la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe one who relishes the taste of meditative concentration,‚Äù

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba nyams su myong bar byed cing de la yon tan du lta ba ni dge ba chos dang sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba nyams su myong bar byed cing de la yon tan du lta ba ni dge ba chos dang sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang du mi len pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos
translated: the one who relishes the taste of meditative concentration and views it as a virtue is a bodhisattva who has fallen away from the virtue of gathering virtue and the virtue of gathering what is wholesome, because he or she does not take up the taste of meditative concentration.

original: so // byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro myong bar byed cing //
analyzed: so // byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i ro myong bar byed cing //
translated: A bodhisattva who relishes the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration

original: de la yon tan du lta bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yon tan du lta bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and views it as a virtue commits an afflicted offense.

original: nyes pa med pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is simply imitating the behavior of others.

original: nyan thos theg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyan thos theg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the verse that begins, ‚ÄúThe one who disparages the Way of the Hearers,‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa lhag par spong bar byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi log par lta ba rnam par spangs pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan par mi bya //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa lhag par spong bar byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi log par lta ba rnam par spangs pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan par mi bya //
translated: The bodhisattva who disparages the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle is like a bodhisattva who has fallen away from the pure morality that is included in the morality of gathering virtue, because he or she has abandoned the morality of abandoning the view of a self and extreme views.

original: gzung bar mi bya //üîΩde la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar mi bya // de la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva should not listen to, should not take up, and should not train in the teachings of the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle.üîΩWhat would a bodhisattva do with the teachings of the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle?üîΩWhat would be the point of listening to, taking up, or training in the teachings of the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle?‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de la bslab pas ci zhig bya ste dgos pa med do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / de la bslab pas ci zhig bya ste dgos pa med do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva were to have such a view and speak in such a manner, that would be an afflicted offense.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang re zhig brtson par bya dgos na sangs rgyas kyi bka' lta ci smos //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas ni mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang re zhig brtson par bya dgos na sangs rgyas kyi bka' lta ci smos //
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva should strive in the treatises of the tƒ´rthikas, not to mention the scriptures of the Buddha.

original: gcig tu de la 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gcig tu de la 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this, because it is done with the sole intention of turning them away from their own treatises.

original: rang tshul yod bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rang tshul yod bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúwhile possessing one‚Äôs own system,‚Äù

original: de la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhes bya bar sbyor ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la mi slob par nyan thos kyi theg pa la brtson pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis thos pa dang bsam pa la mngon par sbyor ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: de la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhes bya bar sbyor ro // byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la mi slob par nyan thos kyi theg pa la brtson pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis thos pa dang bsam pa la mngon par sbyor ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: ‚Äústriving‚Äù is to be supplied from the previous line.üîΩNot training in the bodhisattva canon but striving in the vehicle of the hearers is a Dharma that is like a misdeed because it is a downfall through not applying oneself to listening and reflection in the morality of gathering virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi theg pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yod bzhin du de la brtson @213a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi theg pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod yod bzhin du de la brtson @213a * //
translated: A bodhisattva who, while possessing the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, the bodhisattva canon, does not train in it but trains in the vehicle of the hearers is a bodhisattva who is not skilled in means.

original: bar mi byed par de thams cad du yal bar bor nas nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la brtson par sbyor zhing goms par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar mi byed par de thams cad du yal bar bor nas nyan thos kyi sde snod nyid la brtson par sbyor zhing goms par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he abandons all of them, and applies himself to the Sravaka Canon alone, and becomes accustomed to it, he becomes guilty of an offense with defilement.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod med pa dang / de la goms pa nyid du byas pa dang / rgyun du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bzung ba yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod med pa dang / de la goms pa nyid du byas pa dang / rgyun du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bzung ba yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is in a place where there is no Bodhisattva Canon, and he has already become accustomed to it, and he is constantly occupied with the Bodhisattva Canon, he is not guilty.

original: brtson min zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩbrtson par byed pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtson min zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Not striving and so on.üîΩStrive is to be supplied.

original: brtson pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: Strive means to become accustomed.

original: brtson min zhes bya ba la ni brtson par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: brtson min zhes bya ba la ni brtson par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Not striving means not striving.

original: de'i gzhung mngon par shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la brtson par byed pa ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: de'i gzhung mngon par shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la brtson par byed pa ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: If he strives in the external treatises which are not the subject matter of that Canon, as was just described, he is guilty of an offense similar to a transgression.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyid med kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin yod bzhin du phyi rol gyi bstan bcos te mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la brtson par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyid med kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin yod bzhin du phyi rol gyi bstan bcos te mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la brtson par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva does not have the Bodhisattva Collection, but does have the Buddha Word, and yet strives in the treatises of outsiders, i.e., the treatises of the heterodox, he commits an offense with defilement.

original: shin tu yid gzhungs pa dang ldob skyen pa dang / yun ring por yang yid mi brjed pa dang / don sems pa dang rtog par byed nus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la rigs pas nye bar rtogs pa dang ldan pas blo mi 'gyur ba dang ldan zhing nyin gcig bzhin du ches lhag par sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byed pa yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shin tu yid gzhungs pa dang ldob skyen pa dang / yun ring por yang yid mi brjed pa dang / don sems pa dang rtog par byed nus pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la rigs pas nye bar rtogs pa dang ldan pas blo mi 'gyur ba dang ldan zhing nyin gcig bzhin du ches lhag par sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byed pa yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he is very intelligent, has a good memory, does not forget for a long time, is able to think about and understand the meaning, and has the intelligence to understand the Buddha Word by means of reasoning, and if he has a stable mind and strives day by day to increase his understanding of the Buddha Word, there is no offense.

original: brtson pa byas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brtson pa byas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If he does not strive in the Buddha Word, etc.

original: brtson par bya ba la goms pa des kyang phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la mkhas par byed pa na de la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis pha rol gyi bstan bcos dag la mkhas par byed cing des dga' bar 'dzin des rangs par byed de //
analyzed: brtson par bya ba la goms pa des kyang phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dag la mkhas par byed pa na de la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis pha rol gyi bstan bcos dag la mkhas par byed cing des dga' bar 'dzin des rangs par byed de //
translated: And by that habituation to striving, when he becomes learned in the external treatises, he becomes learned in the treatises of the opponents in the manner of taking delight in them, and he holds to that delight, he delights in that.

original: sman tsha ba la brten pa bzhin du nyes par mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: sman tsha ba la brten pa bzhin du nyes par mi 'dzin la /
translated: He does not hold it to be a fault, as if he were relying on a hot medicine.

original: bdag nyid 'dor bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dor bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he abandons himself, it is a defiled fault.

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase the Mahayana, etc., is as follows:

original: theg pa chen po'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la 'jug pa ni 'dir theg pa chen po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la 'jug pa ni 'dir theg pa chen po'i sgra'o //
translated: The word Mahayana here refers to the engagement in the Mahayana alone.

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa gang la la zhig zab pa'i gnas dag spong ba ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu dang / lta ba ngan pa spong ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa gang la la zhig zab pa'i gnas dag spong ba ni 'das ma thag pa lta bu dang / lta ba ngan pa spong ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: The phrase a certain one who possesses the Mahayana refers to someone who abandons the profound subjects, like the one just mentioned, and who falls away from abandoning bad views. Therefore, it is a Dharma that is like a basis for a misdeed.

original: byang @213b chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de kho na'i don nam //
analyzed: byang @213b chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de kho na'i don nam //
translated: Any bodhisattva who, in the Bodhisattva Collection, understands the meaning of just those words,üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu las brtsams te zab pa mchog tu zab pa'i gnas dag thos nas bdag nyid ma mos shing gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang nas skur ba 'debs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu las brtsams te zab pa mchog tu zab pa'i gnas dag thos nas bdag nyid ma mos shing gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang nas skur ba 'debs te /
translated: If a bodhisattva, having heard from the bodhisattva collection the profound topics that are the meaning of reality or the powers of the bodhisattvas, does not have faith in them and, following others, denigrates them,

original: 'di dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di dag ni don dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: saying, These are not meaningful,

original: chos dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: they are not Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin /
translated: they are not the teachings of the Tathagata,

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes zer zhing spong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes zer zhing spong bar byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they are not for the benefit and happiness of sentient beings, then that is an emotionally tainted offense.

original: gang yang las dang po pa la la zhig zab pa'i gnas dag la sems mos par ma gyur pa de lta na yang de la dad pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis 'di ni bdag dang mi mthun pa ma yin no zhes bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang las dang po pa la la zhig zab pa'i gnas dag la sems mos par ma gyur pa de lta na yang de la dad pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis 'di ni bdag dang mi mthun pa ma yin no zhes bslab par bya ste /
translated: If a beginner has not developed faith in the profound topics, then even though that is the case, he should train in the thought, This is not incompatible with me, because faith is foremost.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni long bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni long bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, I am blind,

original: mig med pas chos yongs su spong ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin no zhes yang dag par brtag par bya'o //üîΩbdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa las nyams
analyzed: mig med pas chos yongs su spong ba ni bdag gi cha ma yin no zhes yang dag par brtag par bya'o // bdag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims 'chal ba'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa las nyams
translated: and it is not proper for me to abandon the Dharma because I have no eyes.

original: pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: In the phrase ‚ÄúI am not to be found, etc.,‚Äù to praise oneself and disparage others is a fault like a basis of offense because it is a cause of immorality, which is the opposite of the morality of gathering virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis dam pa yin pa'i rlom sems kyis bdag la chags pa dang / gzhan la khong khro bas brnyas pa dang bcas pa dang / gshe ba dang bcas pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis dam pa yin pa'i rlom sems kyis bdag la chags pa dang / gzhan la khong khro bas brnyas pa dang bcas pa dang / gshe ba dang bcas pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is naturally superior, through pride, is attached to self, and through contempt and anger, disparages others, and praises himself and disparages others, commits an offense with reactive emotions.

original: nyes pa med pa ni pham par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa ni pham par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: The absence of a fault is like a defeat.

original: chos kyi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the phrase for the sake of the Dharma, and so on,

original: chos nyan pa'i don 'gro bar mi byed pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi thos pa la mngon par sbyor ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i don 'gro bar mi byed pa ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi thos pa la mngon par sbyor ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: not going for the sake of listening to the Dharma is a Dharma-like offense that is a basis for downfalls, because it is a degeneration of the morality of gathering virtue through listening to the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos sgrogs pa dang / chos dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nang rgyal lam khong khro ba'i sems kyis mi 'gro na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos sgrogs pa dang / chos dang 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa nang rgyal lam khong khro ba'i sems kyis mi 'gro na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva does not go to a Dharma teacher or to a discussion of the Dharma out of a mind of anger or hostility, he or she acquires an afflicted offense.

original: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is due to laziness and so on, it is not an afflicted offense.

original: ma tshor ba dang log par ston du dogs pa dang / chos @214a * //
analyzed: ma tshor ba dang log par ston du dogs pa dang / chos @214a * //
translated: If one does not go because one thinks that the Dharma teacher is not a suitable vessel for the Dharma, or because one thinks that the Dharma teacher is not a suitable vessel for the Dharma, or because one thinks that the Dharma is not being taught properly, or because one thinks that the Dharma is not being taught in full, or because one thinks that the Dharma is not being taught in a way that is easy to understand, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the scriptures, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the treatises, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the instructions, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the higher training in ethics, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the higher training in the mind, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the higher training in wisdom, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the three higher trainings, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the path of the ten virtuous actions, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the path of the four truths, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the path of the twelve links of dependent origination, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the path of the perfections, or because one thinks that the Dharma is being taught in a way that is not in accord with the path of the bodhisattva, or

original: smra ba'i sems srung bar 'dod pa dang / na ste mi nus pa dang / yang dang yang du thos shing bzung la shes zin pa'i don gyi gtam yin par shes pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa yin pa dang /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson pa dang shin tu shes rab rtul te len pa la zhan /
analyzed: smra ba'i sems srung bar 'dod pa dang / na ste mi nus pa dang / yang dang yang du thos shing bzung la shes zin pa'i don gyi gtam yin par shes pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / thos pa bsags pa yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson pa dang shin tu shes rab rtul te len pa la zhan /
translated: One who wishes to protect the mind of one who speaks, one who is unable due to illness, one who knows that the discourse is about a meaning that has been heard and grasped repeatedly, one who is very learned, one who retains what he has heard, one who has accumulated much hearing,

original: 'dzin pa la zhan cing dmigs pa la sems rnam par 'jog pa la zhan pa zhig na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la zhan cing dmigs pa la sems rnam par 'jog pa la zhan pa zhig na nyes pa med do //
translated: one who is striving to accomplish the bodhisattva's meditative absorption, and one who is very dull-witted, weak in grasping, weak in retaining, and weak in placing the mind on the object - for them there is no fault.

original: de la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding condemning that, and so on,

original: de la ni chos ston pa'i gang zag la'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos ston pa'i gang zag la'o //
translated: that refers to the person who teaches the Dharma.

original: smad pa ni brnyas pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa ni brnyas pa'o //
translated: Condemning means despising.

original: yi ge dang tshig 'bru la brten nas tshig 'bru la rton pa nyid do zhes de la smod pa'i don du yi ge la brten pa ni de la smod pa dang yi ge rten no //
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig 'bru la brten nas tshig 'bru la rton pa nyid do zhes de la smod pa'i don du yi ge la brten pa ni de la smod pa dang yi ge rten no //
translated: Relying on syllables and words means relying on the words, and condemning that means condemning that.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don ni bzung la chos smra ba la khyad du gsod pa'i ched du tshig 'bru la kun du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don ni bzung la chos smra ba la khyad du gsod pa'i ched du tshig 'bru la kun du bzung nas zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning of the true reality is grasped, but for the purpose of despising the Dharma teacher, the words are grasped.

original: chos smra ba la khyad du gsad pa'i ched du tshig 'bru la brten pa nyid ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bla ma la rim gro byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: chos smra ba la khyad du gsad pa'i ched du tshig 'bru la brten pa nyid ni dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis bla ma la rim gro byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Despising the Dharma teacher for the purpose of words is a Dharma that is like a basis of wrong action because it is a degeneration of the morality of gathering virtuous Dharmas through service to the guru.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba'i gang zag la bsams bzhin du khyad du gsod cing bkur sti mi byed la 'phya bar byed cing tshig 'bru la rton gyi don la rton par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta re zhig tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba'i gang zag la bsams bzhin du khyad du gsod cing bkur sti mi byed la 'phya bar byed cing tshig 'bru la rton gyi don la rton par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro // de lta re zhig tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: If a bodhisattva intentionally despises a Dharma teacher, does not respect them, scolds them, and relies on the words but does not rely on the meaning, it is an afflicted fault.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams bstan nas /
translated: Thus, up to this point, the bases of training have been taught from the perspective of the three types of morality.üîΩNow, the bases of training are taught from the perspective of the morality of gathering virtue.

original: de'i 'og tu yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: After that, it should be understood that the morality of working for the welfare of sentient beings is the basis of the vow, up to the point of its completion.

original: dgos pa'i grogs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dgos pa'i grogs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase not to be a companion in need and so on.

original: dgos pa'i grogs ni grogs byed pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i grogs ni grogs byed pa ste /
translated: A companion is one who helps.

original: der 'gro bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: der 'gro bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not go to him.

original: ji skad smras pa'i bya bar nye bar gnas pa la gzhan gyi grogs mi byed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba rnams kyi grogs byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i don gnyer bar gnas shing bcol ba la khong khro ba'am /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i bya bar nye bar gnas pa la gzhan gyi grogs mi byed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba rnams kyi grogs byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so // byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba'i don gnyer bar gnas shing bcol ba la khong khro ba'am /
translated: Not to be a companion to one who is engaged in what he has promised is a Dharma-like offense because it is a falling away from helping sentient beings.

original: nga rgyal gyi grogs byed du mi 'gro na /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi grogs byed du mi 'gro na /
translated: If a bodhisattva who is engaged in working for the welfare of sentient beings does not go to help someone who is angry or proud,üîΩbecause he is occupied with something else,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: @214b le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @214b le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is due to laziness, etc., it is an unafflicted offense.

original: na ste mi nus pa dang gzhan la sngar khas blangs zin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa dang / yid rtul po zhig ste mi mkhas pa yin pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi nang khrims srung bar 'dod pa dang /üîΩgzhan mang po dag gis sems srung bar 'dod pa dang ma bcol ba dang / bcol bar gyur kyang gzhan zhig la yang bcol ba dang / gnod pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: na ste mi nus pa dang gzhan la sngar khas blangs zin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa dang / yid rtul po zhig ste mi mkhas pa yin pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi nang khrims srung bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan mang po dag gis sems srung bar 'dod pa dang ma bcol ba dang / bcol bar gyur kyang gzhan zhig la yang bcol ba dang / gnod pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: It is not a downfall if one is sick and unable, if one has already promised to do so for another, if one is constantly striving in virtue, if one is dull-witted and inexperienced, if one wishes to train oneself by that method, if one wishes to protect the rules of the community,

original: chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bya ba yin pa dang / pha rol po rang nyid byed nus pa dang / rten yod pa nyid yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bya ba yin pa dang / pha rol po rang nyid byed nus pa dang / rten yod pa nyid yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: if one wishes to protect the minds of many people, if one has not been asked, if one has been asked but has delegated the task to another, or if the task is harmful or not in accord with the Dharma, or if the other person is able to do it by himself, or if there is a basis for doing so.

original: nad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Not caring for the sick, etc.

original: nad pa'i rim gro mi byed pa ni nad pa'i rim gro byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: nad pa'i rim gro mi byed pa ni nad pa'i rim gro byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not caring for the sick is a rule-like-the-dharmas-of-the-dharmas because it is a downfall from the practice of caring for the sick.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nad kyis thebs pa'i sems can dang phrad pa na khong khro ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nad kyis thebs pa'i sems can dang phrad pa na khong khro ba'am /
translated: When bodhisattvas meet beings who are sick, they are not irritated.

original: nga rgyal gyis rim gro dang bsnyen bkur mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis rim gro dang bsnyen bkur mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When a bodhisattva encounters a sick sentient being, if he or she does not serve and honor him or her out of anger or pride, then he or she commits an offense with reactive emotions.

original: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is due to laziness, etc., then it is an offense without reactive emotions.

original: nad yun rings kyis thebs te so tsam du 'dug pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nad yun rings kyis thebs te so tsam du 'dug pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the sick person is able to care for him or herself, or if the bodhisattva is sick too, or if the bodhisattva is practicing Dharma, such as listening to the Dharma, and is unable to get up because of being absorbed in the practice.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang grogs su 'gro ba bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar ro //üîΩsdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang grogs su 'gro ba bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar ro // sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The rest of the cases should be understood as appropriate in the same way as the case of a companion.

original: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams kyi zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams kyi zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who are suffering‚Äù and so on is to be supplied in each case.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal rnams ji skad bstan pas sdug bsngal sel bar mi byed pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal rnams ji skad bstan pas sdug bsngal sel bar mi byed pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdoes not remove the suffering of others‚Äù means that he or she fails to remove the suffering of others as it has been described. This is an offense with an indeterminate result, because it is similar to a Dharma offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can dang phrad na nga rgyal gyis sam khong khro bas sdug bsngal de sel bar mi byed cing yal bar 'jog la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can dang phrad na nga rgyal gyis sam khong khro bas sdug bsngal de sel bar mi byed cing yal bar 'jog la rgyab kyis phyogs par byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva encounters a suffering sentient being and does not remove that suffering out of pride or anger, or if he or she ignores it and turns away, then this is an emotionally tainted offense.

original: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //üîΩnyes pa med pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o // nyes pa med pa ni 'das ma thag pa bzhin no //
translated: Laziness and so on are not emotionally tainted.üîΩThere is no offense if the bodhisattva is incapacitated by some illness or the like.

original: bag med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bag med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The next verse treats heedlessness.

original: bag med pa rnams la ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa mi ston pa ni rigs pa ston pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes pa byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: bag med pa rnams la ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa mi ston pa ni rigs pa ston pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes pa byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not teaching the proper methods to the heedless is a Dharma offense similar to a fault, because it is a failure to teach the proper methods.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin par zhugs pa'i @215a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin par zhugs pa'i @215a * //
translated: A bodhisattva who is not properly engaged in the aims of this life and the next

original: sems can dag mthong na kun nas mnar sems kyis rig pa ston par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dag mthong na kun nas mnar sems kyis rig pa ston par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he sees sentient beings and does not teach them out of a hostile mind, he acquires an afflicted offense.

original: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If he does not teach them out of laziness, etc., he acquires an unafflicted offense.

original: bdag nyid mi shes pa dang gzhan dag la bcol na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi shes pa dang gzhan dag la bcol na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he himself does not know the teaching, or if he is ill and unable, or if he delegates it to another who is competent.

original: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩbyas pa ni pha rol gyis phan gdags pa'o //
analyzed: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / byas pa ni pha rol gyis phan gdags pa'o //
translated: The verse declares:

original: de'i phyir de la phan gdags pas slar phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ni lan du phan 'dogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la phan gdags pas slar phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ni lan du phan 'dogs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving done a favor, he does not repay it or reciprocate with an equal favor. He does not protect the gratitude that is the antidote to ingratitude.‚Äù

original: gzhan phan 'dogs par mi byed pa la rjes su mthun pas slar phan 'dogs par mi byed pa ni byas pa la gzo ba rjes su srung ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan phan 'dogs par mi byed pa la rjes su mthun pas slar phan 'dogs par mi byed pa ni byas pa la gzo ba rjes su srung ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: He does not repay a favor that was done for him, or reciprocate with an equal favor. He does not protect the gratitude that is the antidote to ingratitude. This is a Dharma that is like a fault, because it is a falling away from the protection of gratitude.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rang nyid nus pa dang ldan nam mi ldan yang rung //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rang nyid nus pa dang ldan nam mi ldan yang rung //
translated: Whether or not a bodhisattva is able to do something,

original: kun nas mnar sems dang ldan pa dang / snying brtse ba dang zhes dang bral bas yon tan len par mi byed pa dang / dmu rgod kyi rang bzhin can dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gzhan gyis yongs su zin pa dang / gzhan gyis phan btags pa byas pa'ang rung //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems dang ldan pa dang / snying brtse ba dang zhes dang bral bas yon tan len par mi byed pa dang / dmu rgod kyi rang bzhin can dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gzhan gyis yongs su zin pa dang / gzhan gyis phan btags pa byas pa'ang rung //
translated: One does not repay the help of others.

original: sems can phan 'dogs pa de mthong na byas pa mi gzo ste /
analyzed: sems can phan 'dogs pa de mthong na byas pa mi gzo ste /
translated: One does not repay the help of others when one sees that one is being helped by others.

original: nga rgyal dang khong khro bas mnyam pa'am de bas lhag pa'i mthun pa'i phan gdags pas lan du phan mi 'dogs na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khong khro bas mnyam pa'am de bas lhag pa'i mthun pa'i phan gdags pas lan du phan mi 'dogs na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not repay the help of others with a similar or greater help because of pride or anger, one commits an offense with affliction.

original: le lo la sogs pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is due to laziness, etc., it is an unafflicted offense.

original: lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir 'bad kyang ma nus pa dang / de nyid lan du phan gdags par mi 'dod pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lan du phan gdags pa'i phyir 'bad kyang ma nus pa dang / de nyid lan du phan gdags par mi 'dod pa dang / thabs des 'dul bar 'dod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is unable to help in return despite one's efforts, if one does not want to help in return, or if one wants to subdue the other by that means.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse states, If one does not help others, etc.

original: gzhan rnams kyi mya ngan bsang bar mi byed pa ni mya ngan bsang bar byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi mya ngan bsang bar mi byed pa ni mya ngan bsang bar byed pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not to dispel the sorrow of others is a Dharma that is similar to a misdeed because it is a falling away from the practice of dispelling sorrow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nye du dang longs spyod las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag cing mya ngan byung ba rnams la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems kyis mya ngan bsang bar mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //

translated: If a bodhisattva, out of a hostile mind, does not dispel the sorrow of those who are afflicted and sorrowful because of the loss of relatives and wealth, he or she commits an offense with affliction.

original: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is due to laziness, etc., it is an unafflicted offense.

original: nyes pa med pa ni grogs su 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa ni grogs su 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: There is no offense if one is sick and unable, or if one sends a companion, and so on.

original: nor 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nor 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
