original: nor 'dod pa rnams la @215b nor sbyin par mi byed pa ni phan 'dogs pa sbyin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: nor 'dod pa rnams la @215b nor sbyin par mi byed pa ni phan 'dogs pa sbyin pa las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: Not to give wealth to those who desire wealth is a Dharma that is similar to a misdeed because it is a falling away from the practice of giving assistance.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can phongs pa rnams zas dang skom la sogs pa yo byad 'dod pa rnams yang dag par slong ba la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems kyis zas dang skom la sogs pa sbyin par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par
translated: When a bodhisattva does not give food, drink, and so on, to those who are in need of material things such as food and drink, and who are requesting them, with a hostile mind, he or she commits an offense with defilement.

analyzed: 'gyur ro // le lo la sogs pas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //

original: gtam byar mi rung la bka' blo mi bde zhing mnar sems kyi shas che ba yal bar bor ba dang / dus la gzhes pa dang / gzhi de las 'thab @216b pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur ba mthong ba dang /
analyzed: gtam byar mi rung la bka' blo mi bde zhing mnar sems kyi shas che ba yal bar bor ba dang / dus la gzhes pa dang / gzhi de las 'thab @216b pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur ba mthong ba dang /
translated: who is uncooperative, who has a bad temper, who is very hostile, who is a troublemaker, who is quarrelsome, or who is argumentative.

original: dge 'dun bye bar dogs pas yal bar bor ba dang / sems can de dag rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pas myur ba nyid du rang nyid phyir 'chos pa zhig yin na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun bye bar dogs pas yal bar bor ba dang / sems can de dag rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pas myur ba nyid du rang nyid phyir 'chos pa zhig yin na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is observing a truce in order to divide a faction of the Sa·πÖgha that is intent on schism, or if the sentient beings are naturally modest and ashamed of their faults and quickly make amends for their faults on their own.

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvarious kinds of magical power‚Äù and so on refers to the following.

original: rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs pa dang ldan zhing bsdigs par 'os pa rnams la bsdigs pa la sogs pa mi byed pa ni bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs pa dang ldan zhing bsdigs par 'os pa rnams la bsdigs pa la sogs pa mi byed pa ni bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba las nyams pa'i phyir nyes byas kyi gnas lta bu'i chos so //
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses various kinds of magical power and who fails to use his or her magical power to threaten those who are worthy of being threatened, etc., commits an offense and a transgression, and he or she acquires an afflicted offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul rnam pa mang po'i nus mthu dang ldan la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul rnam pa mang po'i nus mthu dang ldan la /
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses the ability to perform many kinds of magical feats,

original: sems can skrag par bya bar rigs pa rnams rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du mas skrag par mi byed pa dang / sems can 'dun par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams 'dun par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can skrag par bya bar rigs pa rnams rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du mas skrag par mi byed pa dang / sems can 'dun par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams 'dun par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not frighten those who should be frightened by various kinds of miracles, and if one does not inspire faith in those who should be inspired with faith, then one commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: sems can rnams gang du shas cher mngon par zhen par gyur pa mu stegs can 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa dang / log par lta ba dang ldan pa zhig na ma bstan kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams gang du shas cher mngon par zhen par gyur pa mu stegs can 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa dang / log par lta ba dang ldan pa zhig na ma bstan kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If sentient beings are strongly attached to something, and if they are tƒ´rthikas who denigrate the noble ones and possess wrong views, then there is no offense if one does not teach them.

original: de ltar re zhig nyes byas kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan nas yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nyes byas kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan nas yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, having taught the classification of wrong actions, how should one understand what is not an offense?

original: snying rjer ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: snying rjer ldan zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIf one is compassionate,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir bsgrub pa'i sgo dang / dgag pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba gang cung zad bstan pa de las mi 'da' bas ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ltung bar mi 'gyur ba gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub pa'i sgo dang / dgag pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba gang cung zad bstan pa de las mi 'da' bas ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni ltung bar mi 'gyur ba gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the bodhisattva does not transgress any of the bodhisattva activities that have been taught, either by way of the positive practice or by way of the negative practice. Therefore, he does not fall into transgression. This is the clear teaching of the non-transgression.

original: 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang nyes pa med pa nyid ni 'di ltar sems dge ba ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang nyes pa med pa nyid ni 'di ltar sems dge ba ste /
translated: Even if he has the nature of a transgressor, he is still without fault. It is like this: he has a virtuous mind,

original: dge ba'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / 'bras bu gcig pa'i dbang gis rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu las de dang 'dir ji skad du bstan pa las ma nyams par brtse ba dang ldan pa snying rje dang ldan pa sems can rnams la byams pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / 'bras bu gcig pa'i dbang gis rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu las de dang 'dir ji skad du bstan pa las ma nyams par brtse ba dang ldan pa snying rje dang ldan pa sems can rnams la byams pa ste /
translated: a virtuous intention, an unimpaired intention, and a similar result. He is compassionate, full of compassion, and loving toward sentient beings.

original: phan par 'dod pa dang / dul bar 'dod pa dad gdul bar bya bar 'dod pas 'da' bar byas pa ni nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan par 'dod pa dang / dul bar 'dod pa dad gdul bar bya bar 'dod pas 'da' bar byas pa ni nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is desirous of benefit, desirous of taming, and desirous of disciplining. The meaning is that he does not transgress what has been taught here, and he does not fall into transgression.

original: ngang gi sgras ni sems shin tu 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba drag pos nyen pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / tha mal pa ma yin pa dang / spong bar 'dod kyang @217a * //
analyzed: ngang gi sgras ni sems shin tu 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba drag pos nyen pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / tha mal pa ma yin pa dang / spong bar 'dod kyang @217a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù indicates that there is no offense if the mind is extremely disturbed, if one is afflicted by intense pain, if one is asleep, if one is not an ordinary person, or if one wishes to reject the mental afflictions but is overwhelmed by the intensity of the afflictions and is unable to do so.

original: nyon mongs pa drag pos kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa dag gis slar yang 'jug pa dag gis 'das pa las ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drag pos kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa dag gis slar yang 'jug pa dag gis 'das pa las ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the condensed meaning of the verse.üîΩThe verse states:üîΩWhen the mind is extremely disturbed,üîΩwhen one is afflicted by painful feelings,

original: sems ni shin tu nyon mongs dang // sdug bsngal tshor bas nyen pa dang // gnyid dang smyos pa dag la ni //
analyzed: sems ni shin tu nyon mongs dang // sdug bsngal tshor bas nyen pa dang // gnyid dang smyos pa dag la ni //
translated: when one is asleep or insane,

original: byung ba la yang nyes pa med //
analyzed: byung ba la yang nyes pa med //
translated: there is no offense for what occurs.

original: ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gzhan no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa gzhan no //
translated: This is another verse.

original: don ni 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ni 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is presented as follows.

original: chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / phrag dog dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa la sogs pas 'das par gyur pa ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / phrag dog dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa la sogs pas 'das par gyur pa ni nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that if one is overcome by attachment, anger, jealousy, rage, resentment, pride, conceit, and so on, one commits an offense.

original: des na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dngos su byung ba 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi rnams dngos su byung ba 'di dag ni mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: Thus, these precepts of the bodhisattvas that have been presented here are a brief summary.

original: gzhan byang chub sems dpa' dag gi spyod pa rnams ni dpag tu med cing mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan byang chub sems dpa' dag gi spyod pa rnams ni dpag tu med cing mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is immeasurable and limitless.

original: de rnams su bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyes par 'gyur ba dang nyes par mi 'gyur ba dag rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams su bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyes par 'gyur ba dang nyes par mi 'gyur ba dag rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand what is and is not an offense by following the explanations in those scriptures.

original: de ltar na rang gi 'dul ba'i bslab pa la 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi 'dul ba'i bslab pa la 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is engaged in the precepts of his own discipline will experience happiness through three perfections.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of practice, the perfection of aspiration, and the perfection of prior cause.

original: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dag bral bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dag bral bar mi byed cing /
translated: The perfection of practice is that a bodhisattva does not violate morality.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyes par rgyun du mi byed pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyes par rgyun du mi byed pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: It is the purification of the conduct of body, speech, and mind, the non-performance of evil, and the confession of evil.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni gang yang 'di ni chos kyi bsam pas rab tu byung ba yin gyi 'tsho ba'i bsam pas ma yin byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba yin gyi don du gnyer ba ma yin /

translated: The perfection of aspiration is that one goes forth with the aspiration for the Dharma, not with the aspiration for livelihood; one seeks great enlightenment, not its opposites;üîΩand one seeks the religious life and nirvana, not their opposites.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba yin gyi don du mi gnyer ba ma yin pa dang / de de ltar don du gnyer bas le los gnas pa ma yin /

original: brtson 'grus mi zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang rgya shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang rgya shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is not associated with the following: laziness, attachment, affliction, rebirth, disease, painful karmic maturation, or the sin of not being reborn in the future.

original: sngon @217b gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu bsod nams byas shing dge ba byas te /

translated: The perfection of previous causes is such that the bodhisattva in previous lives has created merit and done what is wholesome.

analyzed: bshad pa'i bsod nams rdo rjes sgrib pa'i ri bo'i tshogs //
translated: The merit of explaining them will split the mountain of obscurations,

translated: And having split it, together with the Victor, with pure,üîΩStainless eyes, may I see the suchness of things.
